 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="233" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:174.8pt;">
  <p style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pro Forma</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="72" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:54.2pt;">
  <p style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(13,670,542</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 2.25pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="5" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.85pt;">
  <p style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="30" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:22.85pt;">
  <p style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(0.42</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 2.25pt 0pt;width:4.65pt;">
  <p style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="67" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:50.35pt;">
  <p style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(12,868,052</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 2.25pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="5" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.85pt;">
  <p style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="30" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:22.85pt;">
  <p style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(0.48</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 2.25pt 0pt;width:4.65pt;">
  <p style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.65pt;">
  <p style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On April&nbsp;8, 2005, the Board of Directors of the
Company voted to accelerate the vesting of all outstanding and unvested options
held by directors, officers and employees under the Company&#146;s stock option
plans. As a result of the acceleration, options to acquire 633,333 shares of
the Company&#146;s common stock, which otherwise would have vested from time to time
over the next 48 months, became immediately exercisable. Included in the
options to acquire 633,333 shares of the Company&#146;s common stock were (i)&nbsp;options
to purchase 591,583 shares with exercise prices greater than the Company&#146;s
closing stock price on April&nbsp;8, 2005 ($1.59) (the &#147;underwater options&#148;)
and (ii)&nbsp;options to purchase 41,750 shares with exercise prices below the
Company&#146;s closing stock price on April&nbsp;8, 2005 (the &#147;in-the-money options&#148;).
The underwater options had a weighted average exercise price of $2.23 per share.
The in-the-money options had a weighted average exercise price of $1.04 per
share. Under the accounting guidance of APB 25, the accelerated vesting
relating to the in-the-money options resulted in a charge for stock-based
compensation of approximately $34,330, which was recognized by the Company in
the third fiscal quarter of fiscal 2005. The Company had calculated this charge
based on the intrinsic value of each option at the date of acceleration, taking
into account the remaining unvested shares, each unvested share&#146;s exercise
price as compared to the price on the day the vesting of the options was
accelerated.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">In taking this action, the Board
of Directors </font>considered whether it would be advantageous to the employee
base to have their options become fully vested. The Board of Directors
concluded that, because the employees had not had significant raises over the
past few years and had stayed with the Company during difficult times, and
because the financial impact to the Company of the vesting was minimal, these
options should be vested.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">68</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='68',FILE='C:\fc\92123030577_D11086_1955560\8406-1-fo.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 12:31 2007' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>


<p style="margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As a
direct result of the acceleration of the employee stock options, the amount
shown above for fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2005, include
approximately $860,000 of stock based employee compensation expense that would
have been accounted for in subsequent periods had the unvested options not been
accelerated. The table below details the Stock Based Employee Compensation
Expense for fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2005:</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The effects of applying SFAS No.&nbsp;123 in this pro
forma disclosure are not indicative of future amounts. SFAS No.&nbsp;123 does
not apply to awards prior to 1996.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
weighted-average grant-date fair value of options granted during the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2006, the three month period ended December&nbsp;31, 2005 and
the fiscal years ended September&nbsp;30, 2005 and 2004 were $1.82, $1.13,
$1.77 and $1.95, respectively, per option. The fair value of each stock option
is estimated on the date of the grant using the Black-Scholes option-pricing
model with the following range of assumptions:</font></p>

  <td width="94" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="11" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="115" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="11" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="108" style="border:none;"></td>

</div>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The option life was determined using the
simplified method for estimating expected option life, which qualify as
&#147;plain-vanilla&#148; options.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The stock volatility for each grant is
measured using the weighted average of historical daily price changes of the
Company&#146;s common stock over the most recent period equal to the expected option
life of the grant, the historical short term trend of the option and other
factors, such as expected changes in volatility arising from planned changes in
the Company&#146;s business operations.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The risk-free interest rate for each grant is
equal to the U.S. Treasury yield curve in effect at the time of grant for
instruments with a similar expected life.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(4)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The forfeiture rate for each option grant is
6.25%. Upon adoption of the provision all outstanding stock options were
vested. The forfeiture rate is reviewed by the Company periodically.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In December&nbsp;2005, the
Company granted 50,000 shares of restricted common stock to a senior executive
as permitted under the 2005 Stock Incentive Compensation Plan. This grant vests
12,500 shares per quarter over four quarters. 12,500 of these restricted shares
vested during each of the quarters ended April&nbsp;1, 2006, July&nbsp;1, 2006,
September&nbsp;30, 2006 and December&nbsp;31, 2006. Compensation expense for
the number of shares issued is recognized over the service period and is
recorded in the consolidated statement of operations as a component of selling,
general and administrative expense. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006
and the three month period ended December&nbsp;31, 2005, compensation expense
of </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">69</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='69',FILE='C:\fc\88193747562_D11090_1939533\8406-1-fq.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 29 19:38 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$69,476
and $1,523, respectively, have been recognized related to this restricted stock
award. The Company valued this restricted stock grant of $1.41&nbsp;per share
using the Black-Scholes option pricing model. This amount is included in the
table above that presents share-based
compensation expense included in the Company&#146;s consolidated statement of
operations.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net Loss per Basic
and Diluted Common Share</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company reports net
loss per basic and diluted common share in accordance with SFAS No.&nbsp;128, <i>Earnings Per Share</i>, which establishes
standards for computing and presenting earnings per share. Basic earnings per
share excludes dilution and is computed by dividing income available to common
stockholders by the weighted average number of common shares outstanding for
the period. Diluted earnings per share reflects the potential dilution that
could occur if securities or other contracts to issue common stock were
exercised or converted into common stock or resulted in the issuance of common
stock that then shared in the earnings of the Company, except when the effect
would be anti-dilutive.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Concentration of
Credit Risk</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Financial instruments that subject the Company to
concentrations of credit risk principally consist of cash equivalents, trade
accounts receivable, unbilled contract costs and deposits in bank accounts.
Deposits in excess of amounts insured by the Federal Deposit Insurance
Corporation (FDIC) of $100,000 are exposed to loss in the event of
nonperformance by the institution. The Company has had cash deposits in excess
of the FDIC insurance coverage. The Company deposits its cash and invests in
short-term investments primarily through a national commercial bank.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s trade
accounts receivable and unbilled contract costs and fees are primarily from
sales to U.S. government agencies and commercial customers. The Company does
not require collateral and has not historically experienced significant credit
losses related to receivables or unbilled contract costs and fees from
individual customers or groups of customers in any particular industry or
geographic area.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Research and
Development Costs</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company expenses
research and development costs as incurred. Research and development and other
revenue expenses include costs incurred in connection with both funded research
and development and other revenue arrangements and unfunded research and
development activities.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Comprehensive
Income (Loss)</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Comprehensive income
(loss) includes net loss, change in unrealized gains and losses on marketable
securities and foreign currency translation adjustments.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Fair Value of
Financial Instruments</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s financial instruments consist of cash
equivalents, accounts receivable, unbilled contract costs and fees, warrants to
purchase shares of common stock, accounts payable, debt instruments, convertible
notes, and Series&nbsp;B preferred stock. The estimated fair values of these
financial instruments approximate their carrying values at December&nbsp;31,
2006 and 2005. The estimated fair values have been determined through
information obtained from market sources and management estimates.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">70</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 9.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Inventory
includes material, labor and overhead and consisted of the following:</font></p>

  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The provision for excess and obsolete inventory, net of
usage, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, the three months ended December&nbsp;31,
2005 and the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2005 and 2004 was $248,299, $72,030,
$(708,569) and $(316,386), respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 9.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At the end of June&nbsp;2003,
the Company was actively engaged in selling the Shaker product line, and was
pursuing a strategy that it hoped would lead to a strategic alliance with a
larger company for the development and exploitation of the advantages embodied
in the Uninterruptible Power Supply (&#147;UPS&#148;) system. During the process of
considering various options, the Company concluded that both its Shaker and UPS
system inventories were overvalued based upon the June&nbsp;2003 plan. The
Company analyzed the situation, recorded an increase to its valuation reserve
of approximately $2.0 million and was actively considering offers for this
product line. This reserve was based on the Company&#146;s assessment of the
situation as of that time; The Company had no orders associated with this
reserved inventory and there was no sales force dedicated to the sales and
marketing of these products. During the first quarter of fiscal 2004, the
Company decided to terminate discussions about the possible sale of the Shaker
product line and focus on generating orders. At the end of the first quarter of
fiscal 2004, the gross inventory for the Shaker product line inventory totaled
$2.1 million and the valuation reserve against that inventory was $2.0&nbsp;million,
or 95%. During the second, third and fourth quarters of fiscal 2004, the
Company was successful in resuming sales levels of Shakers. As a result,
inventory that had largely been written-down was used. In addition, the Company
had originally accrued approximately $900,000 for purchase commitments related
to the UPS and Shaker product lines (See Note L. Commitments and Contingencies).
In December 2005 the Company sold its Shaker and Amplifier product lines and
associated inventory. The table below details the resulting approximate
reduction of costs related to both the inventory reserves of our Shaker and UPS
product lines, as well as reserves established related to the purchase
commitments as follows:</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="33" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:24.4pt;">
  <p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Period</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">

  </td>

  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Value&nbsp;of<br>

  </td>
  <td width="67" colspan="4" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:50.25pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Value&nbsp;of<br>
  Purchase<br>
  Commitments<br>
  Reserve&nbsp;Used</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.65pt;">
  <p style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Depreciation and amortization expense relating to
property and equipment for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, the three
month period ended December&nbsp;31, 2005 and for fiscal years ended September&nbsp;30,
2005 and 2004 was $934,457, $241,899, $1,346,142 and $1,426,343, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2005, there was
$1,486,360, respectively, of property under capital leases included in
machinery and equipment. As of December&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2005, there was $29,910,
respectively, of property under capital leases that were included in computer
software.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2005, accumulated
depreciation and amortization included $894,303 and $745,667, respectively,
associated with these capital leases.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September&nbsp;2006 the Company commenced a
restructuring in its Power Systems US Division. As a result of this
restructuring approximately $0.2&nbsp;million of the net book value of
machinery and equipment was written-off, see Note V &#147;Restructuring Costs&#148; for
more information.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company performed an
impairment test in the fourth quarter of fiscal 2005, based on historical
results and cash flow forecast of the operations in the Worcester facility over
the next four years, representing then remaining term of the lease. The Company
did not expect to recoup the value of its long-lived assets at the Worcester
facility. These assets, before write-down, had an approximate net book value of
$1.2&nbsp;million and were comprised primarily of leasehold improvements made
to the facility and other fixed assets. The Company performed a fair market
analysis of these assets and determined that a $1.2&nbsp;million charge was
required in the quarter ending September&nbsp;30, 2005, representing an impairment
of&nbsp;the long-lived assets.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>INVESTMENT
IN BEACON POWER CORPORATION<a name="H_InvestmentInBeaconPowerCorporat_060147"></a></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On September&nbsp;28, 2001, the Company distributed
5,000,000 shares of Beacon Power common stock to its stockholders. Upon the
distribution of the 5,000,000 shares, the Company recorded the distribution of
the 5,000,000 shares as a reduction of additional paid-in-capital based on the
book value per share prior to the distribution, or $0.59 per share. After the
distribution, the Company owned approximately 11.0% of Beacon Power&#146;s outstanding
voting stock. During June and July 2003, the Company sold all of its shares of
Beacon Power Corporation.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Additionally, the Company
had a warrant to purchase 173,704 shares of Beacon Power&#146;s common stock that
had an exercise price of $1.25 per share and expired in April&nbsp;2005. The
Company accounted for this warrant in accordance with SFAS No.&nbsp;133 and,
therefore, records the warrant at its fair value with changes in fair value
reflected in earnings. In April&nbsp;2005, the warrant expired unexercised.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">72</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">G.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>CONVERTIBLE
DEBT INSTRUMENT AND WARRANT LIABILITIES<a name="D_ConvertibleDebtInstrumentAndWar_054148"></a></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Features of the
Convertible Notes and Warrants</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On July&nbsp;19,
2006, the Company entered into a Securities Purchase Agreement (the &#147;Purchase
Agreement&#148;) with the purchasers named therein (the &#147;Purchasers&#148;) in connection
with the private placement (the &#147;Private Placement&#148;) of:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>$12,000,000
aggregate principal amount of senior secured convertible notes (the &#147;Notes&#148;),
convertible into shares of our the Company&#146;s common stock at a conversion price
of $1.65 per share;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Warrant
A&#146;s to purchase up to an aggregate of 3,636,368 shares of our the Company&#146;s
common stock at a price of $1.815 per share for a period beginning six months
from the date of such warrants and ending on the seventh anniversary of the
date of such warrants; and</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Warrant
B&#146;s to purchase up to an aggregate of 3,636,368 shares of the Company&#146;s common
stock at a price of $1.68 per share for a period of 90 trading days beginning
the later of six months from the date of such warrants and the date the Securities
and Exchange Commission (the &#147;SEC&#148;) declares effective a shelf registration
statement covering the resale of the common stock underlying the securities
issued in the Private Placement (the &#147;Registration Statement&#148;); to the extent
the Warrant B&#146;s are exercised, the Purchasers will receive additional warrants,
as described below. Because the registration statement was declared effective
on September&nbsp;27, 2006, these warrants were originally exercisable for the
90 trading day period beginning six months from the date of such warrants (i.e.
May&nbsp;30, 2007). On December&nbsp;20, 2006 the Warrant B&#146;s were amended to
extend the expiration date of&nbsp;the Warrant B&#146;s issued in the Private
Placement from May&nbsp;30, 2007 to August&nbsp;31, 2007. In addition, this
amendment amended the definition of &#147;Excluded Stock&#148; set forth in the Purchase
Agreement to enable the Company to issue up to 1.1 million shares of the
Company&#146;s common stock in connection with the early termination of the lease
for the Company&#146;s facility located in Worcester, Massachusetts, without such
shares being subject to the Purchasers&#146; right of participation set forth in the
Purchase Agreement and certain prohibitions set forth in the Notes and related
warrants (as discussed in Note V, we ultimately settled the lease for 850,000
shares).</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In connection with the
Private Placement, we the Company also entered into a Security Agreement, dated
July&nbsp;19, 2006, with the Purchasers, pursuant to which we the Company
granted the Purchasers a security interest in all of our its right, title and
interest in, to and under all of our its personal property and other assets,
including the our its ownership interest in the capital stock of our its subsidiaries,
as security for the prompt payment in full of all amounts due and owing under the
Notes. The following is a summary of the material provisions of the Purchase
Agreement, the Notes, the Warrant A&#146;s and the Warrant B&#146;s. These summaries are
not complete and are qualified in their entirety by reference to the full text
of such agreements, each of which is attached as an exhibit to our Current
Report on Form&nbsp;8-K filed with the SEC on July&nbsp;21, 2006 (and is
incorporated herein by reference). Readers should review those agreements for a
complete understanding of the terms and conditions associated with the Private
Placement.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Securities Purchase
Agreement</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As noted above, the
Purchase Agreement provided for the issuance and sale to the Purchasers of the
Notes, the Warrant A&#146;s and the Warrant B&#146;s for an aggregate purchase price of
$12,000,000. Other significant provisions of the Purchase Agreement include,
among others:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the
requirement that the Company we pay off all amounts outstanding under our
credit facility with Silicon Valley Bank (See Note&nbsp;I);</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">73</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='73',FILE='C:\fc\92123041488_D11086_1955560\8406-1-fs.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 12:33 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>for
so long as the Notes are outstanding, the obligation that the Company we offer
to the Purchasers the opportunity to participate in subsequent securities
offerings (up to 50% of such offerings), subject to certain exceptions for,
among other things, certain underwritten public offerings and strategic
alliances;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>for
so long as the Notes are outstanding, the obligation that the Company we not
incur any indebtedness that is senior to, or on parity with, the Notes in right
of payment, subject to limited exceptions for purchase money indebtedness and
capital lease obligations; and</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the Company&#146;s our obligation
to (i)&nbsp;file the Registration Statement with the SEC within 30 days
following the closing of the Private Placement (which we it has satisfied by
filing a Registration Statement on Form&nbsp;S-3 on August&nbsp;16, 2006),
(ii)&nbsp;use our its best efforts to cause the Registration Statement to be
declared effective within 90 days following the closing of the Private
Placement, (which we have it has satisfied , as the Registration Statement was
declared effective on September&nbsp;27, 20072006) and (iii)&nbsp;use our its best
efforts to keep the Registration Statement effective until the earlier of
(x)&nbsp;the fifth anniversary of the effective date of the Registration
Statement, (y)&nbsp;the date all of the securities covered by the Registration
Statement have been publicly sold and (z)&nbsp;the date all of the securities
covered by the Registration Statement may be sold without restriction under SEC
Rule&nbsp;144(k). If wethe Company fails to comply with these or certain other
provisions, then we the Company will be required to pay liquidated damages of
1% of the aggregate purchase price paid by the Purchasers in the Private
Placement for the initial occurrence of such failure and 1.5% of such amount
for each subsequent 30 day period the failure continues. The total liquidated
damages under this provision are capped at 24% of the aggregate purchase price
paid by the Purchasers in the Private Placement.</p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Senior Secured
Convertible Notes</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Notes have an aggregate principal amount of $12
million and are convertible into shares of our the Company&#146;s common stock at a
conversion price of $1.65, subject to adjustment for stock splits, stock
dividends, combinations, distributions of assets or evidence of indebtedness,
mergers, consolidations, sales of all or substantially all assets, tender
offers, exchange offers, reclassifications or compulsory share exchanges.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Notes bear interest at the higher of (i)&nbsp;7.0%
per annum or (ii)&nbsp;the six-month LIBOR plus 3.5%. Interest is payable
quarterly, beginning on October&nbsp;31, 2006, and may be made in cash or, at the
Company&#146;s option if certain equity conditions are satisfied, in shares of the
Company&#146;s common stock. If interest is paid in shares of common stock, the
price per share will be at a 10% discount to the volume weighted average price
for the 20 trading days preceding the payment date.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">75% of the original principal amount of the Notes is
to be repaid in 18 equal monthly installments ($500,000 per month) beginning on
February&nbsp;28, 2007. Such principal payments may be made in cash or, at our the
Company&#146;s option if certain equity conditions are satisfied, in shares of our
common stock. If principal is paid in shares of common stock, the price per
share will be the lesser of (i)&nbsp;the conversion price or (ii)&nbsp;a 10%
discount to the volume weighted average price for the 20 trading days preceding
the payment date. At any time following the 24 month anniversary of the
issuance of the Notes, the holders may elect to require us the Company to
redeem for cash all or any portion of the outstanding principal on the Notes;
provided, however, that on the 60th&nbsp;month anniversary of the issuance of
the Notes, the Company we will be required to redeem any remaining outstanding
principal and unpaid interest. Notwithstanding the foregoing, at any time
following the one year anniversary of the effective date of the Registration
Statement, the Company we may, under certain circumstances, redeem the Notes
for cash equal to 120% of the aggregate outstanding principal amount plus any
accrued and unpaid interest.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">74</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='74',FILE='C:\fc\92123041488_D11086_1955560\8406-1-fs.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 12:33 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Notes are
convertible at the option of the holders into shares of the Company&#146;s common
stock at any time at the conversion price. If at any time following the one
year anniversary of the effective date of the Registration Statement, the
volume weighted average price per share of common stock for any 20 consecutive
trading days exceeds 175% of the conversion price, then, if certain equity
conditions are satisfied, the Company we may require the holders of the Notes
to convert all or any part of the outstanding principal into shares of common
stock at the conversion price. The Notes contain certain limitations on
optional and mandatory conversion, including that, absent stockholder approval
of the transaction, the Company we may not issue shares of common stock under
the Notes in excess of 19.99% of the our outstanding shares on the closing
date.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The
Notes contain certain covenants and restrictions, including, among others, the
following (for so long as any Notes remain outstanding):</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 50.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the
Company we must maintain aggregate cash and cash equivalents equal to the
greater of (i)&nbsp;$1,000,000 or (ii)&nbsp;$3,000,000 <i>minus</i>
80% of eligible receivables (as defined therein);</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 50.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>if
a change of control of the Company occurs, as defined, the holders may elect to
require us to purchase the Notes for 115% of the outstanding principal amount
plus any accrued and unpaid interest; and</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 50.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the
Company we may not issue any common stock or common stock equivalents at a
price per share less than the conversion price.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Events of default under
the Notes include, among others, payments defaults, cross-defaults, breaches of
any representation, warranty or covenant that is not cured within the proper
time periods, failure to perform certain required activities in a timely
manner, the Company&#146;s our common stock is no longer listed on an eligible
market, the effectiveness of the Registration Statement lapses beyond a
specified period and certain bankruptcy-type events involving us or any
significant subsidiary. Upon an event of default, the holders may elect to
require the Company us to repurchase all or any portion of the outstanding
principal amount of the Notes for a purchase price equal to the greater of
(i)&nbsp;115% of such outstanding principal amount, plus all accrued but unpaid
interest or (ii)&nbsp;115% of the then value of the underlying common stock.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Warrant A&#146;s</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Warrant A&#146;s entitle the holders thereof to
purchase up to an aggregate of 3,636,368 shares of the Company&#146;s our common
stock at a price of $1.815 per share for a period beginning six months from the
date of such warrants and ending on the seventh anniversary of the date of such
warrants. The exercise price and the number of shares underlying these warrants
are subject to adjustment for stock splits, stock dividends, combinations,
distributions of assets or evidence of indebtedness, mergers, consolidations,
sales of all or substantially all assets, tender offers, exchange offers,
reclassifications or compulsory share exchanges.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If a change of control of the Company occurs, as
defined, the holders may elect to require us to purchase the Warrant A&#146;s for a
purchase price equal to the Black-Scholes value of the remaining unexercised
portion of each Warrant A.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For so long as any Warrant A&#146;s remain outstanding, we
may not issue any common stock or common stock equivalents at a price per share
less than the conversion price of the Notes. In the event of a breach of this
provision, the holders may elect to require us to purchase the Warrant A&#146;s for
a purchase price equal to the Black-Scholes value of the remaining unexercised
portion of each Warrant A.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If following the later of
(i)&nbsp;the effective date of the Registration Statement and (ii)&nbsp;the six
month anniversary of the issuance date, the volume weighted average price per
share of our common stock for any </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">75</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='75',FILE='C:\fc\92123041488_D11086_1955560\8406-1-fs.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 12:33 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">20
consecutive trading days exceeds 200% of the exercise price, then, if certain
equity conditions are satisfied, we may require the holders of the Warrant A&#146;s
to exercise up to 50% of the unexercised portions of such warrants. If
following the 24 month anniversary of the issuance date, the volume weighted
average price per share of our common stock for any 20 consecutive trading days
exceeds 300% of the exercise price, then, if certain equity conditions are
satisfied, we may require the holders of the Warrant A&#146;s to exercise all or any
part of the unexercised portions of such warrants.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Warrant B&#146;s</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Warrant B&#146;s entitle the holders thereof to
purchase up to an aggregate of 3,636,368 shares of our common stock at a price
of $1.68 per share for a period of 90 trading days beginning the later of six
months from the date of such warrants and the date the SEC declares effective
the Registration Statement. As noted above, as a result of an amendment, the expiration
date of the Warrant B&#146;s is now August&nbsp;31, 2007. The exercise price and the
number of shares underlying these warrants are subject to adjustment for stock
splits, stock dividends, combinations, distributions of assets or evidence of
indebtedness, mergers, consolidations, sales of all or substantially all
assets, tender offers, exchange offers, reclassifications or compulsory share
exchanges.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If a change of control of the Company occurs, the
holders may elect to require us to purchase the Warrant B&#146;s for a purchase
price equal to the Black-Scholes value of the remaining unexercised portion of
each Warrant B.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For so long as any Warrant B&#146;s remain outstanding, we
may not issue any common stock or common stock equivalents at a price per share
less than the conversion price of the Notes. In the event of a breach of this
provision, then the holders may elect to require us to purchase the Warrant B&#146;s
for a purchase price equal to the Black-Scholes value of the remaining
unexercised portion of each Warrant B.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If following the effective date of the Registration
Statement, the volume weighted average price per share of our common stock for
any 20 consecutive trading days exceeds 150% of the exercise price, then, if
certain equity conditions are satisfied, we may require the holders of the
Warrant B&#146;s to exercise any unexercised portions of such warrants.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">To the extent the Warrant
B&#146;s are exercised, the holders thereof will receive additional seven-year
warrants to purchase a number of shares of our common stock equal to 50% of the
number of shares of common stock purchased upon exercise of the Warrant B&#146;s
(the &#147;Additional Warrants&#148;). The Additional Warrants will have an exercise
price of $1.815 per share and shall be substantially the same as the Warrant&nbsp;A&#146;s.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Placement Agent
Warrants</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">First Albany Capital (&#147;FAC&#148;) acted as placement agent
in connection with the Private Placement. In addition to a cash transaction
fee, FAC or its designees were entitled to receive five-year warrants to
purchase 218,182 shares of the Company&#146;s common stock at an exercise price of
$1.87 per share. These warrants will be callable after the second anniversary
of the closing of the Private Placement if the 20-day volume weighted
average price per share of the Company&#146;s common stock exceeds 175% of the
exercise price. At the direction of FAC, these warrants were issued to First
Albany Companies Inc., the parent of FAC.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On December&nbsp;20, 2006, in connection with the
early termination of the lease for the Company&#146;s Worcester facility (see Note T),
the Company entered into a First Amendment to Securities Purchase Agreement
(the &#147;Amendment&#148;) with certain of the Purchasers who participated in the
Company&#146;s Private Placement.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">76</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='76',FILE='C:\fc\92123041488_D11086_1955560\8406-1-fs.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 12:33 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pursuant to the
Amendment:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the
definition of &#147;Excluded Stock&#148; set forth in the Purchase Agreement was amended
to enable the Company to issue up to 1.1 million shares of the Company&#146;s common
stock in connection with the early termination of the lease for the Company&#146;s
facility located in Worcester, Massachusetts, without such shares being subject
to the Purchasers&#146; right of participation set forth in the Purchase Agreement
and certain prohibitions set forth in the Notes and related warrants; and</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the Company agreed to
extend the expiration date of the Warrant B&#146;s issued in the Private Placement
from May&nbsp;30, 2007 to August&nbsp;31, 2007.</p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Accounting for the
Convertible Debt Instrument and Warrants</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has determined that the Notes constitute a
hybrid instrument that has the characteristics of a debt host contract containing
several embedded derivative features that would require bifurcation and
separate accounting as a derivative instrument pursuant to the provisions of
SFAS 133,. &#147;Accounting for Derivative Instruments and Hedging Activities&#148; (SFAS
133). <font style="letter-spacing:-.15pt;">The Company has identified all of the
derivatives associated with the July&nbsp;19, 2006 financing, and concluded
that two of the derivatives cannot be reliably measured nor reliably associated
with another derivative that can be reliably measured. As such, the Company has
appropriately valued these derivatives as a single hybrid contract
together&nbsp;with the Notes. The contract will be remeasured at each period at
the fair value with the changes in fair value recognized in the statement of
operations until the notes are settled. As permitted under SFAS 155, the
Company has elected, as of January&nbsp;1, 2007, to measure the Notes in their
entirety at fair value with changes in fair value recognized as either gain or
loss. This election was made by the Company after determining that the
aggregate fair value of the Notes to be more meaningful in the context of the
Company&#146;s financial statements than if separate fair values were assigned to
each of the multiple embedded instruments contained such Notes.</font></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.15pt;">The Company has determined that this
election will have no impact on the accounting for the Notes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Upon issuance, the Warrant A&#146;s and Warrant B&#146;s, along
with the Placement Agent Warrants did not meet the requirements for equity
classification set forth in EITF Issue 00-19, &#147;Accounting for Derivative
Financial Instruments Indexed to, and Potentially Settled in a Company&#146;s Own
Stock,&#148; because such warrants (a)&nbsp;must be settled in registered shares, and
(b)&nbsp;are subject to substantial liquidated damages if the Company s unable
to maintain the effectiveness of the resale registration of the shares and (c)&nbsp;there
is a cash out election using a Black-Scholes valuation under various circumstances.
Therefore such Warrants are required to be accounted for as freestanding
derivative instruments pursuant to the provisions of SFAS 133. Changes in fair
value are recognized as either a gain or loss in the statement of operations
under the caption &#147;other expense&#148;. In addition, the Warrant B&#146;s are being
classified as a current liability on the balance sheet as they are outstanding
for less than one year.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Upon issuance of the Notes and Warrants the Company
allocated the proceeds received to the Notes and the Warrants on a relative
fair value basis. As a result of such allocation, the Company determined the
initial carrying value of the Notes to be $9.4 million. The Notes were
immediately marked to fair value, resulting in a derivative liability in the
amount of $16.3 million. As of December&nbsp;31, 2006, the Notes have been
marked to fair value resulting in a derivative liability of $12.7 million. The net
charge to other (income) expense for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 was
$4.2 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Upon issuance, the Company allocated $2.7 million of
the initial proceeds to the Warrants and immediately marked them to fair value
resulting in a derivative liability of $4.9 million. As of December&nbsp;31,
2006, the Warrants have been marked to fair value resulting in a derivative
liability of $2.9 million. The charge to other (income) expense for the year
ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 was $0.3 1 million. The Company paid approximately
$1.1 million in cash transaction costs and incurred another $0.2 million in
costs based upon the fair value of the Placement Agent Warrants. These costs
were immediately expensed in the three </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">77</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='77',FILE='C:\fc\92123041488_D11086_1955560\8406-1-fs.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 12:33 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">and nine month periods
ended September&nbsp;30, 2006 as other (income) expense. The transaction costs
were immediately expensed as part of the fair value adjustment.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The debt discount in the amount of $2.6 million
(resulting from the allocation of proceeds) is being amortized to interest
expense using the effective interest method over the expected term of the
Notes. The Company amortized approximately $0.2 million for the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2006, which is a component of interest expense.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A summary
of changes in the Notes, Warrants and Placement Agent Warrants is as follows:</font></p>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">H.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>LINE
OF CREDIT<a name="I_LineOfCredit_060158"></a></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On December&nbsp;12, 2003, the Company amended its
loan agreement with Silicon Valley Bank (the &#147;Bank&#148;). Under the amended
agreement, the Bank agreed to provide the Company with a line of credit of up
to $6,250,000 (the &#147;Amended Loan&#148;). The Amended Loan was secured by most of the
assets of the Company and advances under the Amended Loan were limited to 80%
of eligible accounts receivables, which would permit borrowings up to
$5,000,000. Interest on outstanding borrowings accrued at a rate equal to the
Bank&#146;s prime rate of interest plus 1.5% per annum. In addition, the Company
agreed to pay to the Bank a collateral handling fee of 2.4% per annum of the
average daily outstanding balance. The interest rate could increase to the Bank&#146;s
prime rate plus 3.0% per annum and the collateral handling fee increases to
3.0% per annum if the Company failed to meet certain financial ratios. In
addition, the Company had agreed to the following fees: (i)&nbsp;a $23,250
non-refundable facility fee upon the execution of the agreement; (ii)&nbsp;an
unused line fee in an amount equal to 0.50% per annum on the difference between
$5&nbsp;million and the average daily principal balance of the loans
outstanding during the month; and (iii)&nbsp;an early termination fee of
$25,000 if the Company terminates the agreement before June&nbsp;12, 2004. The
Amended Loan contained certain financial covenants relating to net tangible
worth, as defined, which the Company had to satisfy in order to continue
borrowing from the Bank. The Amended Loan was due to mature on December&nbsp;9,
2004. In connection with the Amended Loan, the Company issued to the Bank a
warrant to purchase up to 16,164 shares of its common stock, at an exercise
price of $2.32 per share. This warrant was immediately exercisable and expires
on December&nbsp;11, 2010. The Company valued this warrant at $32,087, using
the Black-Scholes option-pricing model and treated this as a deferred financing
cost and amortized this value on a straight line basis through December&nbsp;9,
2004. As of September&nbsp;30, 2004, the Company was in compliance with the
covenants of this agreement. On December&nbsp;21, 2004 the Company amended the
Amended Loan to extend its expiration through March&nbsp;1, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Effective January&nbsp;31, 2005, the Company entered
into a new loan agreement with the Bank (the &#147;New Loan&#148;), which replaced the
Amended Loan. Under the terms of the New Loan, the Bank agreed to provide the
Company with a credit line of up to $7.0 million. The New Loan was secured by
most of the assets of the Company and advances under the New Loan were limited
to 80% of eligible receivables and up to $1.0 million based on the levels of
eligible inventory. Interest on outstanding borrowings accrued at </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">78</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='78',FILE='C:\fc\92123041488_D11086_1955560\8406-1-fs.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 12:33 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the Bank&#146;s prime rate of
interest plus 2% per annum. In addition, the Company paid to the Bank a
collateral handling fee of $1,000 per month and agreed to the following
additional fees: (i)&nbsp;$25,000 commitment fee; (ii)&nbsp;an unused line fee
in the amount of 0.5% per annum; and (iii)&nbsp;an early termination fee of
0.5% of the total credit line if the Company terminated the New Loan within the
first six months. The New Loan contained certain financial covenants relating
to tangible net worth, as defined, which the Company was required to satisfy in
order to continue to borrow from the Bank.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On June&nbsp;29, 2005, the New Loan was modified
pursuant to a Loan Modification Agreement (the &#147;Modification Agreement&#148;)
between the Company and the Bank. The Modification Agreement had an effective
date of May&nbsp;31, 2005. Under the Modification Agreement, certain financial
covenants relating to tangible net worth and minimum cash, which covenants the
Company had to satisfy in order to continue to borrow from the Bank, were
modified. </font>The Bank also
provided a waiver for the Company&#146;s failure to comply with the minimum tangible
net worth requirements as of May&nbsp;31, 2005. In addition, certain
conditions precedent to the making of advances were also modified. The
Modification Agreement was set to expire on January&nbsp;30, 2006. As
consideration for the modifications, the Company (i)&nbsp;paid the Bank a
modification fee of $20,000 and (ii)&nbsp;issued to the Bank a 10-year warrant
to purchase 151,515 shares of the Company&#146;s common stock at an exercise price
of $1.386 per share. The Company valued these warrants at $119,427 using the Black-Scholes
option pricing model <font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">with the following
assumptions: an expected life of seven years, expected volatility of 52.3%, no
dividends, and risk-free interest rate of 4.0%. The Company has treated this as
a deferred financing cost and amortized this value on a straight line basis
through the remaining term of the New Loan.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On November&nbsp;21, 2005, the New Loan was modified
again pursuant to a Second Loan Modification and Security Agreement (the &#147;Second
Loan Modification Agreement&#148;) between the Company and the Bank. </font>Under the Second Loan Modification Agreement,
the Bank modified the terms related to the collection of receivables for
amounts outstanding under the New Loan, as well as the minimum tangible net
worth covenant, as defined, which the Company had to maintain in order to
continue to borrow from the Bank. The Bank also provided waivers for the
Company&#146;s failure to comply with the minimum tangible net worth requirements as
of August&nbsp;6, 2005 and September&nbsp;30, 2005. In addition, the Second
Loan Modification Agreement provided the ability to borrow up to $3,000,000 on
a revolver basis paying only interest provided that the Company remained in
compliance with all financial covenants, as defined. The Company paid
the Bank&#146;s legal costs associated with the Second Loan Modification Agreement,
which were approximately $5,000.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Effective January&nbsp;31, 2006, the Company entered
into a Third Loan Modification Agreement (&#147;Third Loan Modification Agreement&#148;)
with the Bank, which amended the Company&#146;s credit facility with the Bank. The
Third Loan Modification Agreement, modified the credit facility by extending
the maturity date through February&nbsp;28, 2006. There were no other
modifications.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Effective February&nbsp;10, 2006, the Company entered
into a Fourth Loan Modification Agreement (the &#147;Fourth Loan Modification
Agreement&#148;) with the Bank, which amended its then existing credit facility (as
amended, the &#147;Loan Agreement&#148;). Under the terms of the Loan Agreement, the Bank
agreed to provide the Company with a credit line of up to $7.0 million. The
Loan Agreement was secured by most of the assets of the Company and advances
under the Loan Agreement were limited to 80% of eligible receivables and up to
$1.0 million based on the levels of eligible inventory. Interest on outstanding
borrowings accrued at the Bank&#146;s prime rate of interest plus 1.5% per annum. In
addition, the Loan Agreement provided the ability to borrow up to $3,000,000 on
a revolver basis paying only interest provided that the Company remained in
compliance with all financial covenants, as defined. In addition, the Company
agreed to pay to the Bank a collateral handling fee of $750 per month and
agreed to the following additional fees: (i)&nbsp;$25,000 commitment fee; (ii)&nbsp;an
unused line fee in the amount of 0.5% per annum; and (iii)&nbsp;an early
termination fee of 0.5% of the total credit line if we terminated the Loan
Agreement within the first six months. The Loan Agreement contained certain
financial covenants relating </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">79</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='79',FILE='C:\fc\92123041488_D11086_1955560\8406-1-fs.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 12:33 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">to tangible net worth, as
defined, which we had to satisfy in order to continue to borrow from the Bank. The
Loan Agreement was set to expire on January&nbsp;29, 2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In connection with, and as
a condition precedent to, the completion of the Private Placement, on July&nbsp;19,
2006, the Company paid all amounts due and owing under its credit facility with
Silicon Valley Bank (approximately $2 million) and terminated such facility. In
doing so the Company incurred a termination fee of $17,500 and legal fees of
$8,500. In addition the Company charged to interest expense the remaining
deferred financing costs of $14.583 upon termination of the credit facility.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">I.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>REDEEMABLE
CONVERTIBLE SERIES A AND SERIES B PREFERRED STOCK AND CONVERTIBLE SUBORDINATED
DEBENTURES<a name="J_RedeemableConvertibleSeriesAAnd_060203"></a></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Series&nbsp;A
Convertible Preferred Stock.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On February&nbsp;18, 2003, the Company entered into a
financing transaction that totaled approximately $4&nbsp;million. As part of
this transaction, the Company raised approximately $3.2&nbsp;million of equity
capital through the issuance of 253.8 shares of its Series&nbsp;A convertible
preferred stock, $0.01 par value per share, (&#147;Series&nbsp;A&#148;), and warrants to
purchase up to 2,538,000 shares of its Common Stock from 21 accredited
investors. During the years ended September&nbsp;30, 2004 and 2003, 132.7 and
121.1 shares of the Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock were converted into 1,327,000
and 1,211,000 shares of Common Stock, respectively. After these conversions, as
of September&nbsp;30, 2004, there were no Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock
outstanding.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On September&nbsp;5, 2003, the Company completed the
sale of $762,500 secured subordinated convertible debentures as contemplated by
the Series&nbsp;A financing transaction. The Company received proceeds of
$731,060, net of transaction costs. The subordinated convertible debentures
were due and payable on September&nbsp;5, 2006. The secured convertible
subordinated debentures were initially convertible at a conversion price per
share of $1.25 into 666,000 shares of Common Stock. The subordinated
convertible debentures accrued interest of 10% per annum, increasing to 12% per
annum on January&nbsp;1, 2004. The interest for the first year was paid at
closing by issuing 90,390 shares of Common Stock, valued based on the average
of the closing bid and ask price of the Common Stock on the Nasdaq National
Market for the five trading days preceding September&nbsp;5, 2003, or $79,181.
The Company had recorded this as prepaid interest and amortized the pro-rata
share of the interest through September&nbsp;30, 2003, or $5,432. All further
dividends were to be paid on a quarterly basis. The Company had the right to
pay these dividends in cash or in shares of its Common Stock; in October&nbsp;2003
all outstanding convertible debentures were converted into Common Stock of the
Company.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">H.C. Wainwright&nbsp;&amp; Co.,&nbsp;Inc. (&#147;HCW&#148;)
served as the placement agent for this transaction. As part of their commission
HCW received a cash placement fee of $228,275 and a warrant to purchase an
aggregate of 163,145 shares of Common Stock at an exercise price of $0.01 per
share. This warrant was immediately exercisable and expires on February&nbsp;18,
2008. The Company has valued this warrant at $142,332, using the Black-Scholes
option-pricing model and has treated this as a transaction cost. During
2004, HCW exercised a portion of these warrants for 67,162 shares of Common
Stock. As of December&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2005, warrants to purchase an aggregate
of 10,197 and 30,590 shares of Common Stock remain outstanding, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In connection with the debt portion of this financing,
HCW received a cash placement fee of $58,275 and an additional warrant from the
Company to purchase an aggregate of 42,920 shares of Common Stock at an
exercise price of $0.01. The warrant was issued on February&nbsp;18, 2003 but
was not exercisable until the closing of the debt portion of this financing and
expires on February&nbsp;18, 2008. The Company has valued this warrant at
$37,444, using the Black-Scholes option-pricing model and has
treated this as a transaction cost. As of December&nbsp;31, 2006, warrants to
purchase an aggregate of 4,599 shares of Common Stock remain outstanding. In
lieu of the cash placement fee, HCW elected to receive a warrant from the
Company to purchase an aggregate of 100,148 shares of Common Stock at an
exercise price of $0.01 per </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">80</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='80',FILE='C:\fc\92123041488_D11086_1955560\8406-1-fs.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 12:33 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">share. This warrant was
issued on February&nbsp;18, 2003 but was not exercisable until the closing of
the debt portion of the financing and will expire on February&nbsp;18, 2008.
The Company has valued this warrant at $87,371, using the Black-Scholes
option-pricing model and has treated this as a transaction cost. During
2004, HCW exercised a portion of these Warrants for 37,400 shares of Common
Stock. As of December&nbsp;31, 2006, warrants to purchase an aggregate of
19,864 shares of Common Stock remain outstanding.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In October&nbsp;2003,
the holders of the convertible subordinated debentures converted $762,500 into
610,000 shares of the Company&#146;s Common Stock. As a result of this conversion,
the Company recorded the remaining unamortized balance of the prepaid first
year interest, or $81,155, in October&nbsp;2003. Also in October&nbsp;2003, an
additional investment of $70,000 was made by issuing $70,000 of convertible
subordinated debentures. The Company also issued 8,298 shares of Common Stock
as payment of the first year interest, valued based on the average of the
closing bid and ask price of the Common Stock on the Nasdaq National Market for
the five trading days preceding February&nbsp;18, 2003. These secured
convertible subordinated debentures were subsequently converted at a conversion
price per share of $1.25 into 56,000&nbsp;shares of Common Stock. As a result
of this conversion, the Company recorded all of the interest on these
debentures in October&nbsp;2003. In connection with this transaction, the
Company issued warrants to purchase up to 28,000 shares of Common Stock.
Warrants which were exercised at a price of $1.00 per share, and warrants to
purchase up to 28,000 shares of Common Stock which were exercisable for one
business day after the date of their issuance and had an exercise price of
$0.01 per share. The note purchase agreement required the registration
statement underlying the common stock being declared effective by the SEC.
Failure to satisfy this contingency may have resulted in a portion or all of
the proceeds being returned to the investors. The Company filed the required
registration statement with the SEC on December&nbsp;23, 2003 and it was
declared effective on December&nbsp;31, 2003. After the resolution of this item
outside the Company&#146;s control, the Company accounted for the transaction in
accordance with Emerging Issues Task Force (&#147;EITF&#148;) No.00-27, <i>Application of Issue No.&nbsp;98-5 to Certain
Convertible Instruments (&#147;EITF No.&nbsp;00-27&#148;),</i> allocating the
proceeds received net of transaction costs based on the relative fair value of
the subordinated convertible debentures and the warrants issued to the
investor, and then to any beneficial conversion rights contained in the
convertible redeemable preferred securities as follows:</font></p>
