</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company recognized the
discount as interest expense through the earliest date of conversion and
accordingly, the Company recorded $185,554 of additional interest expense
during the period ended September&nbsp;30, 2004.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Series&nbsp;B
Convertible Preferred Stock.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On October&nbsp;31, 2003, the Company completed a
$7.7&nbsp;million equity transaction involving the issuance of 1,535 shares of
its Series&nbsp;B Convertible Preferred Stock, $0.01 par value per share (the &#147;Series&nbsp;B
Preferred Stock&#148;), and warrants to purchase up to 1,228,000 shares of the
Company&#146;s Common Stock, to accredited investors (the &#147;October&nbsp;2003
Financing Transaction&#148;).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
connection with the October&nbsp;2003 Financing Transaction, the Company issued
shares of Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock for $5,000 per share. The Series&nbsp;B
Preferred Stock is convertible into a number of shares of Common Stock equal to
$5,000 divided by the conversion price of the Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock,
which was initially $2.50. The total number of shares of Common Stock issuable
upon conversion of the shares of </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">81</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='81',FILE='C:\fc\92123041488_D11086_1955560\8406-1-fs.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 12:33 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock issued and sold was
initially 3,070,000. As of September&nbsp;30, 2006 and 2005, 1,190 and 1,110
shares of the Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock had been converted into 2,400,995
and 2,220,000 shares of Common Stock. As a result of the conversions in fiscal
2004, the Company recorded the unamortized balance of the prepaid first
six-month dividend on the converted securities, or $83,248, during the twelve
months ended September&nbsp;30, 2004. In April&nbsp;2006, upon the conversion
of 80 shares of Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock, the Company issued 180,995
shares of common stock. As of December&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2005, the liquidation
preference of the remaining 345 and 425 shares of Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock
was $1,725,000 and $2,125,000, respectively, and these were convertible into
837,379 and 961,538 shares of Common Stock, respectively. Prior to October&nbsp;1,
2005, the Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock accrued dividends of 6% per annum. On October&nbsp;1,
2005, dividends began accruing on the Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock at a rate
of 8% per annum. The dividend for the first six months was paid at closing by
issuing 76,054 shares of Common Stock, valued based on the average of the
closing bid and ask price of the Common Stock on the Nasdaq National Market for
the five trading days preceding October&nbsp;31, 2003. All further dividends
paid on a semi-annual basis. Except in certain limited circumstances, the
Company may opt to pay these dividends in cash or in shares of Common Stock. The
Company has paid all dividends in shares of common stock, in lieu of cash
dividends. The table below details out the number of shares and the amount
charged to other expense during the respective periods:</font></p>

<div align="center">

  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="45" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:34.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">67,292</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="20" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:14.95pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="362" colspan="3" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:271.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Twelve Months ended
  December&nbsp;31, 2006</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.3pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="39" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:29.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">70,792</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.35pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="20" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:14.95pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="45" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:34.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">146,444</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="20" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:14.95pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As part of the October&nbsp;2003 Financing Transaction,
the Company also issued warrants to purchase up to 1,228,000 shares of its
Common Stock (See Note O). These warrants are exercisable for a five-year term
and had an initial exercise price of $3.32 per share, which represented 110% of
the average closing price of the Common Stock for the five trading days
preceding October&nbsp;31, 2003. These warrants were immediately exercisable
and expire on October&nbsp;31, 2008. The Company has valued these warrants at
$2,935,558, using the Black-Scholes option-pricing model. As of December&nbsp;31,
2006 and 2005, warrants to purchase an aggregate of 1,116,000 and 1,228,000
shares of Common Stock remain outstanding, respectively. During the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006, 112,000 of the warrants were exercised in a cashless exercise, resulting
in the issuance of 6,142 shares of Common Stock.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Burnham Hill Partners, LLC, a division of Pali Capital,&nbsp;Inc.
(&#147;BHP&#148;), served as placement agent for this transaction. As part of its
commission, BHP received a cash placement fee equal to 7% of the gross proceeds
received by the Company in connection with the financing. Based on the amount
of the financing, this cash placement fee was approximately $540,000 (including
reimbursement of out-of-pocket expenses), which was paid from gross proceeds received
by the Company. BHP will also receive a cash placement fee of 4% of the
aggregate consideration received by the Company in connection with the cash
exercise of warrants issued to the investors in the financing, as well as
certain warrants issued in the Company&#146;s previous financing (which were
exercised prior to October&nbsp;31, 2003). In addition, BHP, or its assigns,
received warrants, with an exercise price of $0.01 per share, to purchase an
aggregate of 150,430 shares of Common Stock. These warrants were immediately
exercisable and expire on October&nbsp;21, 2008. The Company has valued these
warrants at $435,166, using the Black-Scholes option-pricing model and has
treated this as a transaction cost. As of December&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2005,
warrants to purchase an aggregate of 5,182 shares of Common Stock remain
outstanding.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
stock purchase agreement required that the registration statement registering
the resale of the Common Stock, underlying the Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock
and related warrants, be filed with the SEC within 45 days following the
closing and be declared effective by the SEC, within 120 days following the
closing. </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">82</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='82',FILE='C:\fc\92123041488_D11086_1955560\8406-1-fs.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 12:33 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Failure to satisfy this contingency may have resulted
in liquidating damages or a portion or all of the proceeds being returned to
the investors. The Company filed the required registration statement with the
SEC on December&nbsp;23, 2003 and it was declared effective on December&nbsp;31,
2003. However, because the Company failed to initially file this registration
statement with the SEC on or before December&nbsp;15, 2003, it was potentially
required to pay liquidated damages to each of the investors in the private
offering of 3% of the investor&#146;s investment in cash for the first month of
delay and 1.5% of the investor&#146;s investment for each additional month of delay
in cash or shares of the Company&#146;s common stock, at its option. During fiscal
2004, the Company had accrued $61,400, for these potential penalties, which is
included in selling, general and administrative expenses. After the resolution
of this item outside the Company&#146;s control, the Company accounted for the
transaction in accordance with EITF 00-27, <i>Application
of Issue No.&nbsp;98-5 to Certain Convertible Instruments,</i>
allocating the proceeds received net of transaction costs based on the relative
fair value of the redeemable convertible Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock and the
warrants issued to the investors, and then to any beneficial conversion rights
contained in the convertible redeemable preferred securities as follows:</font></p>

<div align="center">

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="40" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="138" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company recognized the discount as interest
expense through the earliest date of conversion and accordingly, the Company
recorded $6,083,214 of additional interest expense during the year ended September&nbsp;30,
2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As a result of the December&nbsp;2004 financing
transaction (as described in Note N), in accordance with the anti-dilution
provisions of the Company&#146;s Series&nbsp;B Convertible Preferred Stock, the
Company was required to adjust the conversion price of the remaining 425 shares
of Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock outstanding at that time. These shares of Series&nbsp;B
Preferred Stock have a liquidation preference of $5,000&nbsp;per share and are
convertible into a number of shares of Common Stock equal to $5,000 divided by
the conversion price of the Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock, which, as a result
of the December&nbsp;2004 Financing Transaction, was adjusted from $2.50 per
share to $2.36 per share. As of the December&nbsp;2004 financing transaction,
the liquidation preference of the remaining 425 shares of Series&nbsp;B
Preferred Stock was $2,125,000, and these were convertible into 900,424 shares
of Common Stock, after adjustment. The result of the December&nbsp;2004
financing transaction was an additional adjustment of $126,059, which was
recorded as interest expense for the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, in accordance with the anti-dilution
provisions of the warrants issued in connection with the sale of the
Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock (the &#147;Series&nbsp;B Warrants&#148;), the Company was
also required to adjust the exercise price of the Series&nbsp;B Warrants. The
Series&nbsp;B Warrants are exercisable for up to 1,228,000 shares of Common
Stock, are exercisable for a five-year term and had an initial exercise price
of $3.32 per share. As a result of the December&nbsp;2004 financing
transaction, the exercise price on these warrants was adjusted to $3.06 per
share (See Note N). The Company re-valued these warrants using the
Black-Scholes option pricing model with the following assumptions: an expected
life of four years, expected volatility of 73.4%, no dividends, and risk-free
interest rate of 4.0%, resulting in an additional adjustment of $42,920, which
was recorded as interest expense for the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30,
2005.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">83</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

result of the December&nbsp;2004 financing transaction, the Company recorded
the following non-cash charges as interest expense in its Statement of
Operations during the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2005:</font></p>

  <td width="18" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:13.15pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="25" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:19.0pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.06</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="18" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:13.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="45" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:34.0pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">42,920</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="319" colspan="3" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:239.0pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  <td width="18" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:13.15pt;">

  <td width="18" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:13.15pt;">

  <td width="32" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:24.0pt;">

  <td width="18" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:13.15pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="52" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:39.0pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$168,979</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-style:italic;">&nbsp;</font></i></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 10.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As a result of the August&nbsp;2005
financing transaction (as described in Note&nbsp;N), in accordance with the
anti-dilution provisions of the Company&#146;s Series&nbsp;B Convertible Preferred
Stock, the Company was required to adjust the conversion price of the remaining
425 shares of Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock outstanding at that time. These
shares of Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock have a liquidation preference of $5,000
per share and are convertible into a number of shares of Common Stock equal to
$5,000 divided by the conversion price of the Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock,
which, as a result of the December&nbsp;2004 Financing Transaction, had been
adjusted from $2.50 per share to $2.35 per share and as a result of the August&nbsp;2005
Financing transaction had been adjusted from $2.35 per share to $2.21 per
share. At the time of the August&nbsp;2005 financing transaction, 425 shares of
the Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock remained un-converted into shares of Common
Stock. As of the August&nbsp;2005 financing transaction, the liquidation
preference of the remaining 425 shares of Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock was
$2,125,000, and these were convertible into 961,538 shares of Common Stock,
after adjustment. The result of the August&nbsp;2005 financing transaction was
an additional adjustment of $144,231, which was recorded as interest expense
for the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, in accordance with the anti-dilution
provisions of the Series&nbsp;B warrants issued in connection with the sale of
the Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock (the &#147;Series&nbsp;B Warrants&#148;), the Company
was also required to adjust the exercise price of the Series&nbsp;B Warrants. The
Series&nbsp;B Warrants are exercisable for up to 1,228,000 shares of Common
Stock, are exercisable for a five-year term and had an initial exercise price
of $3.32 per share. As a result of the December&nbsp;2004 financing
transaction, the exercise price on these warrants was adjusted to $3.06 per
share (See Note&nbsp;N). As discussed above, as a result of the August&nbsp;2005
financing transaction, the exercise price on these warrants was adjusted to
$2.93 per share (See Note&nbsp;N). In addition, as a result of the August&nbsp;2005
financing transaction The Company re-valued these warrants using the
Black-Scholes option pricing model with the following assumptions: an expected
life of four years, expected volatility of 52.98%, no dividends, and risk-free
interest rate of 4.0%, resulting in an additional adjustment of $21,825, which
was recorded as interest expense for the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30,
2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As a
result of the August&nbsp;2005 financing transaction, the Company recorded the
following non-cash charges as interest expense in its Statement of Operations
during the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2005:</font></p>

<div align="center">

  </td>
  <td width="32" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:24.0pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="18" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:13.15pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="18" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:13.15pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="32" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:24.0pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="18" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:13.15pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-style:italic;">&nbsp;</font></i></p>

  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>

  <td width="45" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:34.0pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">166,056</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-style:italic;">&nbsp;</font></i></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 10.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Ardour Capital
Investments, LLC (&#147;Ardour&#148;), acted as the Company&#146;s financial advisor in
connection with the August&nbsp;2005 financing transaction. The Company agreed
to pay Ardour a fee equal to 6% of the gross proceeds received by the Company
in connection with the financing. Based on the amount of the financing, this
fee was approximately $350,000, which was paid from gross proceeds received by
the Company. In addition, the Company, as part of Ardour&#146;s fee, issued
warrants, with an exercise price of </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">84</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='84',FILE='C:\fc\89214324951_P83101_1948928\8406-1-fu.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 30 21:44 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$1.84
per share, to purchase 93,523 shares of Common Stock. These warrants are
immediately exercisable and have a five year term. The Company valued these
warrants at $43,122, using the Black-Scholes option pricing model, with the
following assumptions: an expected life of five years, expected volatility of
52.98%, no dividends, and risk-free interest rate of 4%.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As a result of the July&nbsp;19, 2006 Private
Placement (as described in Note&nbsp;G), in accordance with the anti-dilution
provisions of the Company&#146;s Series&nbsp;B Convertible Preferred Stock, the
Company was required to adjust the conversion price of the remaining 345 shares
of Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock outstanding at that time. These shares of Series&nbsp;B
Preferred Stock have a liquidation preference of $5,000 per share and are
convertible into a number of shares of Common Stock equal to $5,000 divided by
the conversion price of the Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock, which, as a result
of the July&nbsp;19, 2006 Private Placement, had been adjusted from $2.21 per
share to $2.07 per share. At the time of the July&nbsp;19, 2006 Private
Placement, 345 shares of the Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock remained
un-converted into shares of Common Stock. As of the July&nbsp;19, 2006 Private Placement
the liquidation preference of the remaining 345 shares of Series&nbsp;B
Preferred Stock was $1,725,000, and these are convertible into 833,333 shares
of Common Stock, after adjustment. The result of the July&nbsp;19, 2006 Private
Placement was an additional adjustment of $116,667, which was recorded as
interest expense for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As a
result of July&nbsp;19, 2006 Private Placement, the Company recorded the
following non-cash charges as interest expense in its Statement of Operations
during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, which is included in its results
of operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006:</font></p>

<div align="center">

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As a result of the Company
making the October&nbsp;31, 2006 interest payment on the Notes in stock,
issuing 369,159 shares of common stock, the conversion price of the Series&nbsp;B
Preferred Stock was adjusted again and the following non-cash interest expense
charge was recorded in its Statement of Operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006, which is included in its results of operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006:</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 10.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">J.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>LONG-TERM
DEBT</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Long-term
debt consists of the following:</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 10.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On September&nbsp;29, 2005, the Company re-financed
the amount currently outstanding under its capital lease facility to extend
over the twenty-four months ending September&nbsp;2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At December&nbsp;31,
2006, based on the face value of the notes, maturities of the Company&#146;s Notes
are as follows:</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="174" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:130.8pt;">
  <p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Calendar&nbsp;Years&nbsp;Ending&nbsp;December&nbsp;31,</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="274" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:205.15pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>

  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12,000,000</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 10.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Long-term debt consists of
scheduled principal and interest payments on the Company&#146;s Notes. Principal is
payable in 18 equal installments, which represents 75% of the Notes, with the
remaining 25%, at the election of the investor, is either (i)&nbsp;due on the
18</font><font size="1" style="font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-3.0pt;">th</font>&#160;month or (ii)&nbsp;due on the 60<font size="1" style="font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-3.0pt;">th</font>&#160;month. Principal payments, representing 75% of
the Notes, commenced on February&nbsp;28, 2007. The Notes accrue interest at
the greater of (i)&nbsp;7% or (ii)&nbsp;six month LIBOR plus 350 basis points. At
December&nbsp;31, 2006 the six month LIBOR was 5.4%. Principal and interest may
be paid, at our option, in cash of shares of our common stock. Because
investors may convert principal into common stock at any time, at their option,
the timing of principal and interest payments may accelerate relative to this
schedule.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">K.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>COMMITMENTS AND
CONTINGENCIES</p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating Leases</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company leases its facilities under various operating
leases that expire through October&nbsp;2011.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Future
minimum annual rentals under lease agreements at December&nbsp;31, 2006 are as
follows:</font></p>

  </td>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="55" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:41.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="473" colspan="3" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:354.9pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="55" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:41.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3,606,117</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 10.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total rental expense
including operating expenses and real estate taxes for operating leases
amounted to $1,682,232, $447,845, $1,654,443 and $1,562,307 for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006, the three month period ended December&nbsp;31, 2005 and for the fiscal
years ended September&nbsp;30, 2005 and 2004, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certain of the facility
leases contain escalation clauses, and rental expense has been recognized on a
straight-line basis over the remaining lease term. At December&nbsp;31, 2006
and 2005, deferred rent expense amounted to $206,611, and $206,170,
respectively.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">86</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='86',FILE='C:\fc\89214324951_P83101_1948928\8406-1-fu.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 30 21:44 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Letters of Credit</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company utilizes a
standby letter of credit to satisfy a security deposit requirement and in some
instances to satisfy warranty commitments. Outstanding standby letters of
credit as of December&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2005 were $34,000, respectively. The
Company is required to pledge cash as collateral on these outstanding letters
of credit. As December&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2005, the cash pledged as collateral
for these letters of credit was $34,000, respectively, and is included in
restricted cash and cash equivalents on the balance sheet.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Purchase Commitments</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the ordinary course of
business the Company enters into agreements with vendors for the purchase of
goods and services through the issuance of purchase orders. In general the
majority of these purchases do not represent commitments of the Company until
the goods or services are received. In the third quarter of fiscal 2003 the
company provided for approximately $900,000 related to outstanding purchase
commitments that were related to its Shaker and UPS product lines (see Note&nbsp;D&#151;Inventory).
At December&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2005 the balance outstanding on these purchase
commitments was $237,150 and $327,800, respectively. These amounts are included
in other accrued expenses in the Company&#146;s consolidated balance sheet.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Royalty Agreements</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In connection with the
purchase of certain intellectual property, equipment and other assets from
Sipex Corporation on September&nbsp;27, 2002, Sipex received royalty payments of
$118,422 and $87,594 during fiscal years ended September&nbsp;30, 2005 and
2004, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Employment Agreements</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has employment
agreements with certain employees that provide severance payments and
accelerated vesting of options upon termination of employment under certain
circumstances or a change of control, as defined. As of December&nbsp;31, 2006
and 2005, the Company&#146;s potential obligation to these employees was
approximately $300,000, and $500,000, respectively. During fiscal 2005 the
Company severed the employment of an employee that had an employment agreement
that provided for severance. The Company recorded a charge to operations of
approximately $100,000 related to this severance agreement as selling, general
and administrative expense in its results of operations for the fiscal year
ended September&nbsp;30, 2005. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 the
Company severed the employment of an employee that had an employment agreement
that provided for severance. The Company recorded a charge to operations of
approximately $250,000 related to this severance agreement as selling, general
and administrative expense in its results of operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006. At December&nbsp;31, 2006 approximately $0.2&nbsp;million was accrued.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Contract Losses</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In late fiscal 2002, the
Company entered into a fixed price contract with a customer. The fixed price
contract, which initially totaled $1.1 million, involved milestones and
progress payments and called for the delivery of four prototype power units. These
new power units required substantial engineering to meet the space, thermal and
performance requirements of the customer. At the end of fiscal 2003 the Company
forecasted that the project would be completed during fiscal 2004 and the
Company accrued $0.7 million for the then anticipated cost overrun to be
incurred for the project. Subsequently, the Company was successful in
negotiating with the customer to increase the contract value by $0.4 million to
a total of $1.5 million which was not recorded at that time due to technological
uncertainties that existed at that time.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the third and fourth
quarters of fiscal 2004 and through December&nbsp;23, 2004, the Company
encountered unanticipated problems related to performance requirements. At the
end of the third quarter </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">87</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='87',FILE='C:\fc\89214324951_P83101_1948928\8406-1-fu.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 30 21:44 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">of fiscal
2004 the Company had completed the technical design and was working on
integration and testing. At that time, the Company estimated that it would
incur costs of approximately $3.0 million to complete the project. Accordingly,
the Company has recorded additional charges in fiscal 2004 totaling $0.9
million. During fiscal 2005, there were no changes to the Company&#146;s estimate
and upon completion of the contract $0.1 million was recorded as an additional
charge. All contract elements were delivered to the customer. During the fourth
quarter of fiscal 2005 the Company recognized approximately $1.5 million in
revenue related to this contract. In addition, due to the loss related to this
contract, the Company recorded approximately $0.1 million in costs during
fiscal 2005. As of December&nbsp;31, 2006 the Company did not have any accrued
contract losses recorded.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Litigation</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">From time to time, the
Company is a party to routine litigation and proceedings in the ordinary course
of business. On May&nbsp;19, 2006, the Company filed a suit in U.S. district
court, District of Massachusetts, against one of its customers. The suit
demands full payment of all outstanding amounts due to the Company from its
customer. The customer filed a counterclaim that the Company believed was
without merit. The suit was settled on March&nbsp;9, 2007. The settlement is
not expected to have a material effect on the Company&#146;s financial position or
operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company is not aware
of any current or pending litigation in which the Company is or may be a party
that it believes could materially adversely affect the results of operations or
financial condition or net cash flows.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">L.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>EMPLOYEE
BENEFIT PLAN</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company offers a 401(k)&nbsp;Employee Benefit Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;). Under the
Plan, any regular employee of the Company or its wholly owned US subsidiaries,
as defined by the Plan, who has attained the age of 21&nbsp;years is eligible
to participate. The Plan allows an employee to defer up to 100% of his or her
compensation, as limited under IRC Section&nbsp;402(g), through contributions
to the Plan. The Company matches 100% in the Company&#146;s Common Stock up to the
first 6% of an employee&#146;s pay that he or she contributes to the Plan. Participants
are vested immediately in the matches of the Company Common Stock. The match
contribution will be determined and accrued in dollars and converted to shares
of the Company&#146;s Common Stock using the share price of the last business day of
each calendar quarter. The stock will be issued as soon as practical in the
following period. The table below details out the Company&#146;s matching
contributions made under the Plan, the number of shares of the Company&#146;s Common
Stock issued under the Plan and the value of the Common Stock issued by the
Company as matching contributions to the Plan for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006, the three month period ended December&nbsp;31, 2005 and fiscal years
ended September&nbsp;30, 2005 and 2004, as follows:</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.85pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="331" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:248.2pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Three months ended
  December&nbsp;31, 2005</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.5pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="45" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:34.0pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">154,967</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.5pt;">

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 10.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The value of the Common
Stock issued as matching contributions is based on the closing price of the
Company&#146;s Common Stock on the Nasdaq Market for the last day of the calendar
quarter in which the contributions were earned.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">88</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

provision for income taxes consists of the following:</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Deferred
income taxes reflect the net tax effects of temporary differences between the
carrying amounts of assets and liabilities for financial reporting purposes and
the amounts used for income tax purposes. As of December&nbsp;31, 2005 and
2006, the components of the net deferred tax assets/ (liabilities) are as
follows:</font></p>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 10.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At December&nbsp;31, 2006,
the Company had available net operating loss carryforwards for federal and
state tax purposes of approximately $108,000,000 and $64,000,000, respectively.
The federal net operating losses expire beginning in 2007 through 2025. The
state net operating losses expire beginning in 2006 through 2015.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As required by SFAS No.&nbsp;109,
<i>Accounting for Income Taxes</i>, management
has evaluated the positive and negative evidence bearing upon the realizability
of the Company&#146;s deferred tax assets. Management has determined that it is more
likely than not that the Company will not realize the benefits of federal deferred
tax assets, and as a result, a full valuation allowance has been established.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Of the changes in the
valuation allowance described above for the period ended December&nbsp;31,
2006, an immaterial amount may relate to tax return deductions attributable to
the exercise of non-qualifying </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">89</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='89',FILE='C:\fc\89214324951_P83101_1948928\8406-1-fu.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 30 21:44 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">stock
options or disqualifying dispositions of incentive stock options, and are not
benefited through income.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under the Internal Revenue Code, certain substantial
changes in the Company&#146;s ownership may result in an annual limitation on the
amount of net operating loss and tax credit carryforwards, which may be
utilized in future periods.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The provision for
income taxes differs from the federal statutory rate due to the following:</font></p>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 3.5pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">N.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>STOCKHOLDERS&#146; EQUITY</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 9.5pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December&nbsp;31,
2006, the Company has reserved 9,397,478 shares of Common Stock for issuance
upon exercise of stock options and warrants, 1,116,161 shares for future
issuances under its stock plans and 487,429 shares for future issuances as
matching contributions under its 401(k)&nbsp;plan. The Company has also
reserved 837,379 shares of Common Stock for issuance upon conversion of the
outstanding Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock, which can be converted at any time.
As of December&nbsp;31, 2006, holders of warrants to purchase an aggregate of
11,097,308 shares of the Company&#146;s Common Stock may exercise. As of
December&nbsp;31, 2006, the notes were convertible into 7,272,727 of the
Company&#146;s Common Stock.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 3.5pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Stock Option Plans</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 3.5pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under the Company&#146;s 1992,
1994, 1996, 1998, 1999, 2000, 2002 and 2005 Stock Option Plans (collectively,
the &#147;Plans&#148;), both qualified and non-qualified stock options may be granted to
certain officers, employees, directors and consultants to purchase up to
7,250,000 shares of the Company&#146;s common stock. At December&nbsp;31, 2006,
4,456,745 of the 7,250,000 stock options available for grant under the Plans
have been granted.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 3.5pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Plans are subject to the following provisions:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 3.5pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The
aggregate fair market value (determined as of the date the option is granted)
of the Company&#146;s common stock that any employee may purchase in any calendar
year pursuant to the exercise of qualified options may not exceed $100,000. No
person who owns, directly or indirectly, at the time of the granting of a
qualified option to him or her, more than 10% of the total combined voting
power of all classes of stock of the Company shall be eligible to receive any
qualified options under the Plans unless the option price is at least 110% of
the fair market value of the Company&#146;s Common Stock subject to the option,
determined on the date of grant. Non-qualified options are not subject to this
limitation.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 3.5pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Qualified
options are issued only to employees of the Company, while non-qualified
options may be issued to non-employee directors, consultants and others, as
well as to employees of the Company. Options granted under the Plans may not be
granted with an exercise price less than 100% of fair value of the Company&#146;s
common stock, as determined by the Board of Directors on the grant date.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 3.5pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Options
under the Plans must be granted within 10&nbsp;years from the effective date of
the Plan. Qualified options granted under the Plans cannot be exercised more
than 10&nbsp;years from the date of grant, except that qualified options issued
to 10% or greater stockholders are limited to five-year terms.</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">90</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='90',FILE='C:\fc\89214324951_P83101_1948928\8406-1-fu.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 30 21:44 2007' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>


<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Generally,
the options vest and become exercisable ratably over a four-year period.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The
Plans contain antidilutive provisions authorizing appropriate adjustments in
certain circumstances.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Shares
of the Company&#146;s common stock subject to options that expire without being
exercised or that are canceled as a result of the cessation of employment are
available for future grants.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following table summarizes activity of the Company&#146;s stock plans since
September&nbsp;30, 2003:</font></p>

 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="245" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:184.1pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cancellations</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="60" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:45.35pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1,186,838</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0.375pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.65pt;">

  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Information
related to stock options outstanding as of December&nbsp;31, 2006 is as
follows:</font></p>

<div align="center" style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="200" colspan="3" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:149.75pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

  <td width="15" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.6pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="195" colspan="10" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:145.95pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Options&nbsp;Outstanding</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">91</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='91',FILE='C:\fc\89192648476_D11086_1948233\8406-1-fw.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 30 19:28 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Options for the purchase of 3,673,595 shares were
exercisable at September&nbsp;30, 2005, with a weighted-average exercise price
of $3.98. Options for the purchase of 3,662,595 shares were exercisable at December&nbsp;31,
2005, with a weighted average exercise price of $3.96.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following table summarizes the Company&#146;s non-vested restricted share activity:</font></p>

  <td width="27" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:19.95pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December&nbsp;31, 2006, there was approximately
$1.0 million of total unrecognized costs related to non-vested share-based
compensation arrangements granted under the Company&#146;s stock plans. That cost is
expected to be recognized over a weighted average period of approximately 4
years. Options to purchase 229,850 shares were exercised during the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006; these options had an intrinsic value of approximately $0.2 million on
their date of exercise. Options to purchase 1,000 shares were exercised during
the three month period ended December&nbsp;31, 2005; these options had an
intrinsic value of $580 on their date of exercise.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2000, the Company granted 216,000 non-qualified
stock options to employees at an exercise price of $17.56 per share outside of
the Board approved Plans. As of December&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2005, there were
21,000 options outstanding, respectively, which are included in the above
table. As of December&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2005, an additional 195,000 shares,
respectively, included above were available outside of the Board approved Plans
for future grants.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On April&nbsp;19, 2004, the Company completed the
first phase of its stock option exchange offer. A total of 781,158 options with
an average exercise price of approximately $12.30 were tendered by employees
and directors and then cancelled by the Company in exchange for the future
issuance of options. New options were to be issued in the final phase of the
exchange offer on or after October&nbsp;20, 2004 at the then current market
price to employees and directors who were employed by the Company or served as
directors of the Company from the acceptance date through the date that the new
options were granted. The Company was obligated to issue 684,008 options
associated with the exchange, subject to certain conditions. Executive officers
of the Company elected not to participate in the program. Ultimately, in October&nbsp;2004,
the Company issued 656,008 options with an exercise price of $2.05 per share. The
table above summarizing the stock option activity for the years ended September&nbsp;30,
2005 and 2004 reflects the effect of the stock option exchange offer.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On April&nbsp;8, 2005, the Board of Directors of the
Company voted to accelerate the vesting of all outstanding and unvested options
held by directors, officers and employees under the Company&#146;s stock option
plans. As a result of the acceleration, options to acquire 633,333 shares of
the Company&#146;s Common Stock, which otherwise would have vested from time to time
over the next 48 months, became immediately exercisable. Included in the
options to acquire 633,333 shares of the Company&#146;s Common Stock were (i)&nbsp;options
to purchase 591,583 shares with exercise prices greater than the Company&#146;s
closing stock price on April&nbsp;8, 2005 ($1.59) (the &#147;underwater options&#148;)
and (ii)&nbsp;options to purchase 41,750 shares with </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">92</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='92',FILE='C:\fc\89192648476_D11086_1948233\8406-1-fw.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 30 19:28 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">exercise prices below the
closing stock price of the Common Stock on April&nbsp;8, 2005 (the &#147;in-the-money
options&#148;). The underwater options have a weighted average exercise price of
$2.23 per share. The in-the-money options have a weighted average exercise
price of $1.04 per share. Under the accounting guidance of APB 25, the
accelerated vesting relating to the in-the-money options resulted in a charge
for stock-based compensation of approximately $34,330, which was recognized by
the Company in the third fiscal quarter. The Company had calculated this charge
using the Black-Scholes option pricing model, taking into account the remaining
unvested shares, each unvested share&#146;s exercise price as compared to the price
on the day the vesting of the options was accelerated.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">In
taking this action, the Board of Directors </font>considered whether it would
be advantageous to the employee base to have their options become fully vested.
The Board of Directors concluded that, because the employees had not had
significant raises over the past few years and had stayed with the Company
during difficult times, and because the financial impact to the Company of the
vesting was minimal, these options should be vested.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Warrants</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On December&nbsp;19, 2002, the Company issued to
Silicon Valley Bank, in connection with entering into a forbearance agreement
with Silicon Valley Bank, a warrant exercisable for 15,763 shares of the
Company&#146;s Common Stock, at an exercise price of $1.586 per share. The warrant
expires on December&nbsp;18, 2007. The Company has valued this warrant at
$20,100 using the Black-Scholes option-pricing model and has
designated the warrant as an equity instrument in accordance with EITF 00-19.
As of December&nbsp;31, 2006, this warrant remains outstanding.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">HCW served as placement agent for the February&nbsp;2003
Series&nbsp;A financing transaction and on February&nbsp;18, 2003 received as
part of its commission warrants to purchase an aggregate of 163,145 shares of
Common Stock at an exercise price of $0.01 per share. These warrants were
immediately exercisable and expire on February&nbsp;18, 2008. In connection
with the closing of the transactions contemplated by the note and warrant
purchase agreement, HCW received additional warrants from the Company to
purchase an aggregate of 42,920 shares of Common Stock at an exercise price of
$0.01. These warrants are exercisable from the closing of the transactions
contemplated by the note and warrant purchase agreement and expire on February&nbsp;18,
2008. In addition, HCW agreed to receive warrants to purchase an aggregate of
100,148 shares of Common Stock at an exercise price of $0.01 per share in lieu
of the cash placement fee in connection with the closing of the transactions
contemplated by the Note and Warrant Purchase Agreement. These warrants were
issued on February&nbsp;18, 2003 and were exercisable from the closing of the
transactions contemplated by the note and warrant purchase agreement and will
expire on February&nbsp;18, 2008. The Company had valued these warrants at
$267,147, using the Black-Scholes option-pricing model and has
designated the warrant as an equity instrument in accordance with EITF 00-19.
See Note&nbsp;J.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December&nbsp;31,
2006, the table below details the balance of the warrants issued to HCW by the
Company:</font></p>

<div align="center">

  </td>
  <td width="45" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:34.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">100,148</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.1pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.2pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="25" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:19.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.01</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.25pt;">

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.2pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="45" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:34.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">80,284</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.2pt;">

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="17" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.5pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="39" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:29.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">19,864</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="17" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  2008</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
