</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In October&nbsp;2003, the holders of the convertible
subordinated debentures converted $762,500 into 610,000 shares of the Company&#146;s
Common Stock. As a result of this conversion, the Company recorded the
remaining unamortized balance of the prepaid first year interest, or $81,155,
in October&nbsp;2003. Also in </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">93</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='93',FILE='C:\fc\89192648476_D11086_1948233\8406-1-fw.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 30 19:28 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">October&nbsp;2003, an
additional investment of $70,000 was made by issuing $70,000 of convertible
subordinated debentures. The Company also issued 8,298 shares of Common Stock
as payment of the first year interest, valued based on the average of the
closing bid and ask price of the Common Stock on the Nasdaq National Market for
the five trading days preceding February&nbsp;18, 2003. These secured
convertible subordinated debentures were subsequently converted at a conversion
price per share of $1.25 into 56,000 shares of Common Stock. As a result of
this conversion, the Company recorded all of the interest on these debentures
in October&nbsp;2003. In connection with this transaction, the Company issued
warrants to purchase up to 28,000 shares of Common Stock, which were exercised
at a price of $1.00 per share, and warrants to purchase up to 28,000 shares of
Common Stock, which were exercisable for one business day after the date of
their issuance and had an exercise price of $0.01 per share. As of December&nbsp;31,
2006 and 2005, none of these warrants remained outstanding.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On October&nbsp;31, 2003, the Company completed a
$7.7&nbsp;million financing transaction involving the issuance of 1,535 shares
of the Company&#146;s Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock, and warrants to purchase up to
1,228,000 shares of the Company&#146;s common stock, from 25 accredited investors. The
warrants had an initial exercise price of $3.32 per share, which represents
110% of the average closing price of Common Stock for the five trading days
prior to October&nbsp;31, 2003. These warrants were immediately exercisable and
expire on October&nbsp;31, 2008. As of September&nbsp;30, 2006, 112,000 of
these warrants were exercised, leaving 1,116,000 outstanding as of September&nbsp;30,
2006. Burnham Hill Partners, LLC, a division of Pali Capital,&nbsp;Inc. (&#147;BHP&#148;),
served as placement agent for the transaction. As part of its commission, BHP
received a cash placement fee equal to 7% of the gross proceeds received by the
Company in connection with the financing. Based on the amount of the financing,
this cash placement fee was approximately $540,000 (including reimbursement of
out-of-pocket expenses), which was paid from gross proceeds received by the
Company. BHP will also receive a cash placement fee of 4% of the aggregate
consideration received by the Company in connection with the cash exercise of
warrants issued to the investors in the financing, as well as certain warrants
issued in the Company&#146;s previous financing (which were exercised prior to October&nbsp;31,
2003). In addition, BHP, or its assigns, received warrants, with an exercise
price of $0.01 per share, to purchase an aggregate of 150,430 shares of Common
Stock. These warrants were immediately exercisable and expire on October&nbsp;1,
2008. The Company valued these warrants at $435,166, using the Black-Scholes
option-pricing model and treated this as a transaction cost. As of December&nbsp;31,
2006 and 2005, these warrants were exercised for 145,248 shares of the Company&#146;s
Common Stock. These warrants contained anti-dilution features and as a direct
result of the Company&#146;s December&nbsp;2004 Financing Transaction and the August&nbsp;2005
Financing Transaction, the exercise price for these warrants have been adjusted
to $2.93 per share.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On December&nbsp;12, 2003, the Company amended its
agreement with the Bank. In connection with the Amended Loan, the Company
issued to the Bank a warrant to purchase up to 16,164 shares of its common
stock, at an exercise price of $2.32 per share. This warrant was immediately
exercisable and expires on December&nbsp;11, 2010. &#160;The Company has valued this warrant at
$32,087, using the Black-Scholes option-pricing model and treated this as a
deferred financing cost and amortized this value on a straight line basis
through December&nbsp;9, 2004. As of December&nbsp;31, 2006 none of this
warrant has been exercised.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On December&nbsp;22, 2004, the Company sold 4,848,485
shares of Common Stock under its universal shelf registration statement to a
group of investors for proceeds of $7,470,000, net of transaction costs. As
part of the December&nbsp;2004 financing the Company also issued warrants to
purchase up to 2,181,818 shares of Common Stock. These warrants have an
exercise price of $2.00 per share. &#160;These
warrants were immediately exercisable and expire on December&nbsp;21, 2009. During
the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, 1,227,272 of these warrants were
exercised, resulting in the Company issuing 403,600 shares of common stock. As
of December&nbsp;31, 2006 954,546 warrants, were outstanding.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On March&nbsp;21, 2005, the Company entered into an
agreement with Ardour to serve as the Company&#146;s financial advisor. As part of
this agreement the Company issued to Ardour a 3-year warrant to purchase </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">94</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='94',FILE='C:\fc\89192648476_D11086_1948233\8406-1-fw.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 30 19:28 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">50,000 shares of the
Company&#146;s Common Stock at an exercise price of $2.75 per share. The Company
valued these warrants at $20,490, using the Black-Scholes option-pricing
model and designated the warrant as an equity instrument in accordance with
EITF 00-19. At December&nbsp;31, 2006, none of these warrants have been
exercised.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On June&nbsp;29, 2005, the New Loan was modified
pursuant to a Loan Modification Agreement (the &#147;Modification Agreement&#148;)
between the Company and the Bank. The Modification Agreement had an effective
date of May&nbsp;31, 2005. In connection with the Modification Agreement the
Company issued to the Bank a 10-year warrant to purchase 151,515 shares
of the Company&#146;s Common Stock at an exercise price of $1.386 per share. The
Company valued these warrants at $119,427 using the Black-Scholes option pricing<font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;"> and has treated this as a deferred financing cost
and was amortizing this value on a straight line basis through the remaining
term of the New Loan. At December&nbsp;31, 2006 none of these warrants have
been exercised.</font></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On August&nbsp;15, 2005, the Company sold 4,676,151
shares of Common Stock to accredited investors for proceeds of approximately
$5.4 million, net of transaction costs. As part of this financing the Company
also issued warrants to purchase up to 1,169,038 shares of Common Stock. These
warrants have an exercise price of $1.99 per share, were immediately
exercisable and expire on August&nbsp;12, 2010. In addition, the Company agreed
to pay Ardour a fee of 6% of the net proceeds from the August&nbsp;2005
financing, approximately $347,000 and warrants equal to 2% of the Common Stock
issued in the August&nbsp;2005 financing. The Company issued to Ardour a
warrant to purchase 93,523 shares of Common Stock at an exercise price of $1.84.
These warrants were immediately exercisable and have an expiration date of August&nbsp;14,
2010. As of December&nbsp;31, 2006 none of these warrants have been exercised.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A
summary of the Company&#146;s warrants currently outstanding as of December&nbsp;31,
2006 by issuance date is summarized below:</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A
summary of the status of the Company&#146;s warrants as of the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006 and the three month period ended December&nbsp;31, 2005 and the changes
for these periods are presented below. The actual Common Stock issued on
warrants exercises in 2006 is less than the table presented below due to
cashless exercises. The actual Common Stock issued under warrant exercises for
2006 was 430,135 and the </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">95</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='95',FILE='C:\fc\89192648476_D11086_1948233\8406-1-fw.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 30 19:28 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Company received proceeds of $204. There were no
warrant exercises during the three month period ended December&nbsp;31, 2005 or
the twelve month period ended September&nbsp;30, 2005. The table below reflects
the change in warrant price due to the anti-dilutive provisions of the Series&nbsp;B
warrants as a result of the December&nbsp;2004, August&nbsp;2005 and July&nbsp;19,
2006 Financing Transactions.</font></p>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Consulting
Arrangement with Aurelius Consulting Group,&nbsp;Inc.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pursuant to a marketing
agreement, dated September&nbsp;2, 2003, with Aurelius Consulting Group,&nbsp;Inc.,
as part of the compensation for the services to be provided by Aurelius under
the agreement, which had an initial term of 12&nbsp;months, the Company agreed
to issue to Aurelius 45,000 shares of Common Stock per quarter, payable at the
midpoint of each quarter, subject to renegotiation after the first six months. &#160;As of September&nbsp;30, 2004, the agreement
was renegotiated and the Company issued 90,000 shares of common stock to
Aurelius. Accordingly, the Company expensed approximately $192,000 during
fiscal year 2004.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">O.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>PREFERRED
STOCK</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company is authorized
to issue up to 1,000,000 shares of Preferred Stock, $0.01 par value per share.
The Preferred Stock may be issued in one or more series, the terms of which may
be determined at the time of issuance by the Board of Directors, without
further action by stockholders, and may include voting rights (including the
right to vote as a series on particular matters), preferences as to dividends
and liquidation, conversion and redemption rights and sinking fund provisions. See
Note&nbsp;I for a discussion of redeemable convertible Series&nbsp;A Preferred
Stock issued in February&nbsp;2003 and Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock issued in October&nbsp;2003.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">P.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>SIGNIFICANT
CUSTOMERS</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Significant customers defined as those customers that
account for 10% or more of total net revenue in a fiscal year or 10% or more of
accounts receivable and unbilled contract costs and fees at the end of a fiscal
year. At December&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2005 no single customer accounted for more
than 10% of accounts receivables. In addition, for the fiscal year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2006, the three month period ended December&nbsp;31, 2005, no
single customer accounted for more than 10% of total net revenue.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, management
estimates that approximately 40%, 40%, 40% and 50% of the revenue during the
year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, the three months ended December&nbsp;31,
2005 and the fiscal years ended September&nbsp;30, 2005 and 2004, respectively,
was derived from government contracts and subcontracts with the U.S. government&#146;s
prime contractors.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">96</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='96',FILE='C:\fc\89192648476_D11086_1948233\8406-1-fw.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 30 19:28 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Q.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>SUPPLEMENTAL
DISCLOSURE OF CASH FLOW INFORMATION</p>

  <td width="55" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:41.5pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.25pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="24" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:17.85pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="45" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:34.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="24" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:17.85pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="45" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:34.0pt;">

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest and Income
Taxes Paid</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cash
paid for interest and income taxes was as follows:</font></p>

 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">97</font></p>

<div>


<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">R.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>LOSS
PER SHARE<a name="T_LossPerShare_223425"></a></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following is the reconciliation of the numerators and denominators of the basic
and diluted loss per share computations:</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  </td>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of
the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, the three month period ended December&nbsp;31,
2005 and the fiscal years ended September&nbsp;30, 2005 and 2004, shares of
Common Stock issuable upon the exercise of options and warrants were excluded
from the diluted average common shares outstanding, as their effect would have
been antidilutive. In addition, shares of Common Stock issuable upon the
conversion of redeemable convertible Preferred Stock and Notes were excluded
from the diluted weighted average common shares outstanding as their effect
would also have been dilutive. The table below summarizes the option and
warrants and convertible Preferred Stock that were excluded from the
calculation above due to their effect being antidilutive:</font></p>

<div align="center">

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">S.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>SEGMENT
DISCLOSURES<a name="U_SegmentDisclosures_223426"></a></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s organizational structure is based on
strategic business units that perform services and offer various products to
the principal markets in which the Company&#146;s products are sold. These business </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">98</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='98',FILE='C:\fc\89193513884_D11086_1948233\8406-1-fy.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 30 19:37 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">units equate to four
reportable segments: Applied Technology, Power Systems, US, Power Systems,
Canada and Electronics.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">SatCon Applied Technology,&nbsp;Inc. performs research
and development services in collaboration with third parties. SatCon Power
Systems,&nbsp;Canada, ltd. specializes in the engineering and manufacturing of
power systems. Satcon Power Systems, US specializes in the engineering and
manufacturing of electric motors and hybrid electric automobile systems. SatCon
Electronics,&nbsp;Inc. designs and manufactures electronic products. The
Company&#146;s principal operations and markets are located in the United States. In
previous years the Company has shown SatCon Power Systems US and Canada as one
segment; the table below has been adjusted to show the Power Systems divisions
as separate segments.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The accounting policies of each of the segments are
the same as those described in the summary of significant accounting policies.
The Company evaluates performance based on revenue and profit and loss from
operations, including amortization of intangibles. Common costs not directly
attributable to a particular segment are included in the corporate segment.
These costs include corporate costs such as executive officer compensation,
facility costs, legal, audit and tax and other professional fees.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">99</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='99',FILE='C:\fc\89193513884_D11086_1948233\8406-1-fy.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 30 19:37 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following is a summary of the Company&#146;s operations by operating segment:</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">100</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='100',FILE='C:\fc\89193513884_D11086_1948233\8406-1-fy.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 30 19:37 2007' -->

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Common
assets not directly attributable to a particular segment are included in the
Corporate segment. These assets include cash and cash equivalents, prepaid and
other corporate assets. The following is a summary of the Company&#146;s assets by
operating segment:</font></p>

with its principal markets as follows:</font></p>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">T.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>RESTRUCTURING
COSTS<a name="V_RestructuringCosts_223428"></a></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of September&nbsp;30, 2004, the Company had
$495,612 accrued related to a restructuring cost, which was established in April&nbsp;2002.
On January&nbsp;27, 2005, the Company reached a settlement with the landlord of
the Anaheim, California facility in the amount of $240,000 as final settlement
for all claims. In addition, at that time, the Company determined that all remaining
restructuring liabilities accrued were no longer warranted and that all matters
related to the restructuring charge have been settled; accordingly, the Company
has adjusted all remaining balances related to severance costs, facilities cost
and equipment costs remaining as of January&nbsp;1, 2005, resulting in a
reduction of accrued restructuring charges of $255,612. The remaining balance
was paid by the Company in the quarter ending April&nbsp;2, 2005.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">101</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='101',FILE='C:\fc\89193513884_D11086_1948233\8406-1-fy.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 30 19:37 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

following is a status of the Company&#146;s accrued restructuring costs and the
changes for the periods then ended:</font></p>

</div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:1.0pt;line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On September&nbsp;19,
2006, the Board of Directors approved a plan to close the Company&#146;s Worcester,
Massachusetts manufacturing facility by approximately December&nbsp;31, 2006 in
furtherance of the Company&#146;s continuing efforts to streamline operations and
reduce its operating costs.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December&nbsp;31,
2006, approximately $1.6 million has been incurred by the Company related to
the restructuring. This charge represents approximately $42,000 related to
employee severance, $45,000 related to employee retention payments and $0.2
million in impairment charges related to property, plant and equipment. In
addition, on December&nbsp;22, 2006 the Company came to an agreement with the
landlord of the Worcester facility, whereby the Company would issue 850,000
shares of common stock in exchange for allowing the Company to terminate the
lease early. The stock was issued to the landlord on January&nbsp;3, 2007. The
Company recorded a restructuring charge in the period ended December&nbsp;31,
2006 in the amount of $1.1 million related to this agreement and approximately
$0.2 million related to the revaluation of investor warrants. The Company
anticipates approximately $0.1 million of additional costs related to the
restructuring to be paid out in 2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following is a summary of the Company&#146;s accrued restructuring costs at December&nbsp;31,
2006:</font></p>

<div align="center">

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">U.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>PRODUCT
WARRANTIES<a name="W_ProductWarranties_223430"></a></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In its Power Systems Divisions the Company provides a
warranty to its customers for most of its products sold. In general the Company&#146;s
warranties are for one year after the sale of the product, and in some
instances five years. The Company reviews its warranty liability quarterly. Factors
taken into consideration when evaluating the Company&#146;s warranty reserve are (i)&nbsp;historical
claims for each product, (ii)&nbsp;the development stage of the product, and (iii)&nbsp;other
factors.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following is a summary of the Company&#146;s accrued warranty activity for the
following periods:</font></p>

  <p style="line-height:11.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="57" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:42.85pt;">

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">102</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='102',FILE='C:\fc\89193513884_D11086_1948233\8406-1-fy.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 30 19:37 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">V.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>R<font style="text-transform:uppercase;">ecent</font> A<font style="text-transform:uppercase;">ccounting</font> P<font style="text-transform:uppercase;">ronouncements</font><a name="X_RecentAccountingPronouncements_223430"></a></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In February&nbsp;2006, the FASB issued SFAS No.&nbsp;155,
&#147;Accounting for Certain Hybrid
Financial Instruments&#148; (&#147;SFAS No.&nbsp;155&#148;) which amends SFAS
No.&nbsp;133, &#147;Accounting for Derivative
Instruments and Hedging Activities&#148; (&#147;SFAS No.&nbsp;133&#148;) and SFAS
No.&nbsp;140, &#147;Accounting for Transfers
and Servicing of Financial Assets and Extinguishments of Liabilities&#148; (&#147;SFAS
No.&nbsp;140&#148;). SFAS&nbsp;155 simplifies the accounting for certain derivatives
embedded in other financial instruments by allowing them to be accounted for as
a whole if the holder elects to account for the whole instrument on a fair
value basis. SFAS&nbsp;155 also clarifies and amends certain other provisions
of SFAS&nbsp;133 and SFAS&nbsp;140. SFAS&nbsp;155 is effective for all
financial instruments acquired, issued or subject to a remeasurement event
occurring in fiscal years beginning after September&nbsp;15, 2006. The Company
adopted SFAS&nbsp;155 on January&nbsp;1, 2007. The Company believes that the
adoption of SFAS&nbsp;155 will not have a material effect on our consolidated
financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In June&nbsp;2006, the Financial Accounting Standards
Board (&#147;FASB&#148;) issued FASB Interpretation No.&nbsp;48, &#147;<i>Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes</i>,&#148;
(&#147;FIN No.&nbsp;48&#148;) which is effective for fiscal years beginning after December&nbsp;15,
2006. FIN No.&nbsp;48 clarifies the accounting for uncertainty in income taxes
recognized in the financial statements by prescribing a recognition threshold
and measurement attribute for the financial statement recognition and
measurement of a tax position taken or expected to be taken in a tax return.
FIN No.&nbsp;48 also provides guidance on derecognition, classification,
interest and penalties, accounting in interim periods, disclosure and
transition. The Company is currently evaluating the potential impact of the
adoption of FIN No.&nbsp;48 on our consolidated financial position, results of
operations and cash flows.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September&nbsp;2006, the FASB issued Statement of
Financial Accounting Standards No.&nbsp;157 (SFAS&nbsp;157), Fair Value
Measurements, which defines fair value, establishes guidelines for measuring
fair value and expands disclosures regarding fair value measurements. SFAS 157
does not require any new fair value measurements but rather eliminates
inconsistencies in guidance found in various prior accounting pronouncements.
SFAS 157 is effective for fiscal years beginning after November&nbsp;15, 2007.
Earlier adoption is permitted, provided the company has not yet issued
financial statements, including for interim periods, for that fiscal year. The
Company is currently evaluating the impact of SFAS 157.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September&nbsp;2006,
the SEC released SAB 108, Considering the Effects of Prior Year Misstatements
when Quantifying Misstatements in Current Year Financial Statements. SAB 108
allows registrants to adjust for the cumulative effect of certain errors
relating to prior years in the carrying amount of assets and liabilities as of
the beginning of the current year, with an offsetting adjustment to the opening
balance of retained earnings in the year of adoption provided that management
has properly concluded that the errors were not material to prior periods. SAB
108 also requires the adjustment of any prior quarterly financial statements
within the fiscal year of adoption for the effects of such errors on the
quarters when the information is next presented. Such adjustments do not
require previously filed reports with the SEC to be amended. The Company adopted
the provisions of SAB 108 during fiscal 2006 and determined that the impact on
its consolidated financial position, results of operations and cash flows not
to be material.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">W.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>SUBSEQUENT
EVENTS<a name="Y_SubsequentEvents_223431"></a></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On January&nbsp;31, 2007, the Company elected to
satisfy the February&nbsp;28, 2007 principal payment due on the Notes by
issuing shares of common stock. This issuance was a prepayment, resulting in
the issuance of 445,899 shares of common stock. In addition, on February&nbsp;26,
2007, the Company elected to satisfy the April&nbsp;1, 2007 principal payment
due on the Notes by paying cash in the amount of $500,000 when due on
April&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2007.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">103</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<div>


<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:6.0pt 0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">REPORT
OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM ON<br>
SUPPLEMENTAL SCHEDULE</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">To the Board of Directors
and<br>
Stockholders of SatCon Technology Corporation:</font></p>

<p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt 24.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have audited, in accordance with the Standards of
the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States), the consolidated
financial statements of SatCon Technology Corporation and its subsidiaries as
of December&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2005, and the consolidated results of their
operations and cash flows for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 and the three
month period ended December&nbsp;31, 2005, included in this Form&nbsp;10-K,
and have issued our report thereon dated March&nbsp;23, 2007. Our audits were
made for the purpose of forming an opinion on those consolidated financial
statements taken as a whole. The schedule listed in the financial statement
schedule index is the responsibility of the Company&#146;s management and is
presented for purposes of complying with the Securities and Exchange Commission&#146;s
rules&nbsp;and is not a part of the basic consolidated financial statements. The
schedule for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 and the three month period
ended December&nbsp;31, 2005 has been subjected to auditing procedures applied
in the audits of the basic consolidated financial statements and, in our
opinion, fairly states, in all material aspects, the financial data required to
be set forth therein in relation to the basic consolidated financial statements
taken as a whole.</font></p>

<p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">/s/ Vitale Caturano&nbsp;&amp;
Company, Ltd.</font></p>

<p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt 30.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">VITALE, CATURANO&nbsp;&amp;
COMPANY, LTD.</font></p>

<p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">March&nbsp;23, 2007<br>
Boston, Massachusetts</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">REPORT OF
INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM ON<br>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">To the Board of Directors of SatCon Technology
Corporation:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We
have audited, in accordance with the Standards of the Public Company Accounting
Oversight Board (United States), the consolidated financial statements of
SatCon Technology Corporation and its subsidiaries as of September&nbsp;30,
2005 and the consolidated results of their operations and their cash flows for
each of the two years in the period ended September&nbsp;30, 2005, included in
this Form&nbsp;10-K, and have issued our report thereon dated December&nbsp;15,
2005. Our audits were made for the purpose of forming an opinion on those
consolidated financial statements taken as a whole. The schedule listed in the
financial statement schedule index is the responsibility of the Company&#146;s
management and is presented for purposes of complying with the Securities and
Exchange Commission&#146;s rules&nbsp;and is not a part of the basic consolidated
financial statements. This schedule for the fiscal years ended September&nbsp;30,
2005 and 2004 has been subjected to auditing procedures applied in the audits
of the basic consolidated financial statements and, in our opinion, fairly
states, in all material respects, the financial data required to be set forth
therein in relation to the basic consolidated financial statements taken as a
whole.</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="60" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:45.35pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(411,719</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="62" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:46.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,200,326</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">106</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='106',FILE='C:\fc\89011462_D11085_1941149\8406-1-gc.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 30 00:02 2007' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">


<p style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 47.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-47.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 9.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>CHANGES
IN AND DISAGREEMENTS WITH ACCOUNTANTS ON ACCOUNTING AND FINANCIAL DISCLOSURE<a name="Item9_ChangesInAndDisagreementsWi_233351"></a></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Not applicable.</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 47.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-47.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 9A.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>CONTROLS
AND PROCEDURES<a name="Item9a_ControlsAndProcedures_233421"></a></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)&nbsp;Evaluation
of Disclosure Controls and Procedures.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As required by Rule&nbsp;13a-15 under the
Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as of the end of the period covered by this
report, we carried out an evaluation under the supervision and with the
participation of our management, including our Chief Executive Officer and
Chief Financial Officer, of the effectiveness of our disclosure controls and
procedures as of December&nbsp;31, 2006. While we have identified certain
internal control deficiencies, which are discussed below, our evaluation
indicated that these deficiencies did not impair the effectiveness of our
overall disclosure controls and procedures. Based upon that evaluation, the
Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer concluded that our
disclosure controls and procedures are effective as of December&nbsp;31, 2006
to ensure that information required to be disclosed by us in the reports we
file or submit under the Exchange Act is recorded, processed, summarized and
reported within the time periods specified in the Securities and Exchange
Commission&#146;s rules&nbsp;and forms.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our management and Audit Committee were notified by Vitale,
Caturano&nbsp;&amp; Company (&#147;Vitale&#148;) of two significant deficiencies in our
internal control over financial reporting that they observed during the audit
of the December&nbsp;31, 2006 financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The first significant deficiency relates to a need to formalize
policies and procedures (including a comprehensive accounting and financial
reporting policies and procedures manual, a policy that requires an annual
vacation for all employees and periodic rotation of duties, and policies and
procedures relating to information technology). We had begun to formalize
policies in this area prior to receiving Vitale&#146;s observations and will
continue with these plans.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The second significant
deficiency relates to our review and analysis of the carrying value of
inventory and improving/retaining applicable documentation at certain of our
business segments. Vitale noted an instance of under capitalized labor and
overhead costs at one of our business segments. During 2007, we plan on
continuing efforts to enhance our documentation process and monitoring controls
in this area.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)&nbsp;Changes in
Internal Control Over Financial Reporting.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">There was no change in our
internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the fourth
quarter that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially
affect, our internal control over financial reporting.</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 47.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-47.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 9B.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>OTHER
INFORMATION<a name="Item9b_OtherInformation__233434"></a></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Not applicable</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">107</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">PART&nbsp;III<a name="Partiii_233714"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 47.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-47.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 10.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>DIRECTORS,

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">PART&nbsp;IV<a name="Partiv_234045"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 47.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-47.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 15.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>EXHIBITS,

Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K:</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.</font><i><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-style:italic;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Consolidated

2006 and December&nbsp;31, 2005</font></p>

Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, the Three Month Period Ended December&nbsp;31,
2005 and the Fiscal Years Ended September&nbsp;30, 2005 and 2004</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Consolidated Statements of Changes in Stockholders&#146;
Equity (Deficit) and Comprehensive Loss for the Calendar Year Ended December&nbsp;31,
2006, the Three Month Period Ended December&nbsp;31, 2005 and the Fiscal Years
Ended September&nbsp;30, 2005 and 2004</font></p>

Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, the Three Month Period Ended December&nbsp;31,

to Consolidated Financial Statements</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.</font><i><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-style:italic;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Financial

and 2004</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.</font><i><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-style:italic;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Exhibits:</i></p>

  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Title</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="164" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:123.05pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.45pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="38" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:28.65pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="24" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:17.95pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Date</font></b></p>
  </td>

  the purchasers listed on Schedule I thereto is incorporated herein by

<body lang="EN-US">

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">EXHIBIT 23.1</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">CONSENT OF
INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM<a name="ConsentOfIndependentRegisteredPub_235517"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We
have issued our reports, dated March&nbsp;23, 2007, accompanying the
consolidated financial statements and schedule included in the Annual Report of
SatCon Technology Corporation on Form&nbsp;10-K&nbsp;for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006. We hereby consent to the incorporation by reference of said reports in
the Registration Statements of SatCon Technology Corporation on Form&nbsp;S-8
(File&nbsp;Nos.&nbsp;033-75934, 333-04280, 333-08047, 333-75339,
333-43802, 333-67504, 333-100753, 333-125882 and 333-125883)
and Form&nbsp;S-3 (File Nos. 333-05939, 333-37921, 333-87157,
333-94859, 333-48936, 333-67328, 333-103950, 333-111522,
333-116533, 333-128527, 333-136673 and 333-139897).</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="304" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:228.25pt;">
  <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><!-- SET mrlHTMLTableLeft --><!-- SET mrlNoTableShading -->/s/
  VITALE, CATURANO&nbsp;&amp; COMPANY LTD.</p>
  </td>
  <td width="304" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:228.25pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="304" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:228.25pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Boston, Massachusetts</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="304" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:228.25pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="304" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:228.25pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">March&nbsp;30, 2007</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="304" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:228.25pt;">

  </td>

<body lang="EN-US">

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">EXHIBIT 23.2</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">CONSENT OF
INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM<a name="ConsentOfIndependentRegisteredPub_000031"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We
have issued our reports, dated December&nbsp;15, 2005, accompanying the
consolidated financial statements and schedule included in the Annual Report of
SatCon Technology Corporation on Form&nbsp;10-K for the year ended September&nbsp;30,
2005. We hereby consent to the incorporation by reference of said reports in
the Registration Statements of SatCon Technology Corporation on Form&nbsp;S-8
(File Nos.&nbsp;033-75934, 333-04280, 333-08047, 333-75339,
333-43802, 333-67504, 333-100753, 333-125882 and 333-125883)
and Form&nbsp;S-3 (File Nos. 333-05939, 333-37921, 333-87157,
333-94859, 333-48936, 333-67328, 333-103950, 333-111522,
333-116533, 333-128527, 333-136673 (effective September 27, 2006)
and 333-139897 (effective January 17, 2007)).</font></p>

  THORNTON LLP</p>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-31.1
<SEQUENCE>5
<FILENAME>a07-8406_1ex31d1.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-31.1
<TEXT>
<html>

<head>







</head>

<body lang="EN-US">

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">EXHIBIT 31.1</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certification
Pursuant to<a name="CertificationPursuantTo_000657"></a><br>
Section&nbsp;302 of the<br>
Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">I, David B.
Eisenhaure, certify that:</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>I have reviewed
this annual report on Form&nbsp;10-K of SatCon Technology Corporation;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Based on my
knowledge, this annual report does not contain any untrue statement of a
material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements
made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not
misleading with respect to the period covered by this annual report;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Based on my
knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included
in this annual report, fairly present in all material respects the financial
condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and
for, the periods presented in this annual report;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The registrant&#146;s
other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining
disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e)&nbsp;and
15d-15(e)) for the registrant and have:</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">a)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>designed such
disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and
procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material
information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries,
is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the
period in which this annual report is being prepared;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">b)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>evaluated the
effectiveness of the registrant&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures, and
presented in this annual report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the
disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this
report based on such evaluation; and</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">c)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>disclosed in this annual report any
change in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that
occurred during the registrant&#146;s fourth fiscal quarter that has materially
affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#146;s
internal control over financial reporting; and</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The registrant&#146;s
other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent
evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#146;s
auditors and the audit committee of registrant&#146;s board of directors (or persons
performing the equivalent functions):</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">a)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>all significant
deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal
control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely
affect the registrant&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report
financial information; and</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 40.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">b)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>any
fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who
have a significant role in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial
reporting.</p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="304" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:228.1pt;">
  <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><!-- SET mrlNoTableShading --><!-- SET mrlHTMLTableLeft --></p>
  </td>

  <p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">/s/ DAVID B. EISENHAURE</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">

  <td width="304" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:228.1pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="304" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:228.1pt;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">President
  and Chief Executive Officer</font></i></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="304" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:228.1pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Dated:
  March&nbsp;30, 2007</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="304" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:228.1pt;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-style:italic;">&nbsp;</font></i></p>

</head>

<body lang="EN-US">

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">EXHIBIT 31.2</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certification
Pursuant to<a name="CertificationPursuantTo_001346"></a><br>
Section&nbsp;302 of the<br>
Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">I, Davie E. O&#146;Neil,
certify that:</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>I have reviewed
this annual report on Form&nbsp;10-K of SatCon Technology Corporation;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Based on my
knowledge, this annual report does not contain any untrue statement of a
material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements
made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not
misleading with respect to the period covered by this annual report;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Based on my
knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included
in this annual report, fairly present in all material respects the financial
condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for,
the periods presented in this annual report;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The registrant&#146;s
other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining
disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e)&nbsp;and
15d-15(e)) for the registrant and have:</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">a)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>designed such
disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and
procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material
information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries,
is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the
period in which this annual report is being prepared;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">b)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>evaluated the
effectiveness of the registrant&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures, and
presented in this annual report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the
disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this
report based on such evaluation; and</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">c)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>disclosed in this annual report any
change in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that
occurred during the registrant&#146;s fourth fiscal quarter that has materially
affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#146;s
internal control over financial reporting; and</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The registrant&#146;s
other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent
evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#146;s
auditors and the audit committee of registrant&#146;s board of directors (or persons
performing the equivalent functions):</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">a)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>all significant
deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal
control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely
affect the registrant&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report
financial information; and</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 40.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">b)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>any
fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who
have a significant role in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial
reporting.</p>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-32.1
<SEQUENCE>7
<FILENAME>a07-8406_1ex32d1.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-32.1
<TEXT>
<html>

<head>







</head>

<body lang="EN-US">

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">EXHIBIT 32.1</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certification
Pursuant to<a name="CertificationPursuantTo_001948"></a><br>
18 U.S.C. Section&nbsp;1350,<br>
as Adopted Pursuant to<br>
Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In connection with
the Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K of SatCon Technology Corporation (the
&#147;Company&#148;) for the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 as filed with the
Securities and Exchange Commission on the date hereof (the &#147;Report&#148;), each of
the undersigned officers of the Company hereby certifies, pursuant to 18 U.S.C.
Section&nbsp;1350, that:</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The Report fully complies
with the requirements of Section&nbsp;13(a)&nbsp;or 15(d), as applicable, of
the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;); and</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The information contained
in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial
condition and results of operations of the Company.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">This
certification is being furnished as an exhibit to the Report pursuant to 18
U.S.C. Section&nbsp;1350, as adopted pursuant to Section&nbsp;906 of the
Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, and shall not be deemed &#147;filed&#148; for purposes of Section&nbsp;18
of the Exchange Act, or otherwise subject to the liability of that section. This
certification will not be deemed to be incorporated by reference into any
filing under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, or the Exchange Act,
regardless of any general incorporation language in such filing, except to the
extent that the Company specifically incorporates this certification by
reference.</font></p>
